text: The sushi was awesome we tried the Philadelphia, Rainbow, flying Jason, and black jack roll. All were great. The only reason they got a three is halfway through all of the waiters in the entire restaurant disappeared for 15 minutes. The sushi chef finally called them after we looked around several times. Also the waitress was very rushed and pushy when taking/waiting for your order but then never comes back. Go for good sushi, not service.

This has been my #1 pick sushi spot since I moved to vegas from LA!! Hard to compare to the sushi places back home, but this one is great! Staff is great n the food is just amaze-balls!! The atmosphere is family friendly and fun! My favorite is the volcano roll & baked mussels! The only thing I wish they would add to their menu is green tea tempura ice cream!! Every sushi bar I've been to serves it except this one!! Hopefully they will add it soon.. Other than that no question about it.. If you're a local n love sushi this place is for you!!!

Sushi Tachi offers an All You Can Eat menu at a reasonable price.  I was there on 3/16/12. The food was great, the service was superior and the staff was friendly and prompt.  I plan on dining there again very soon

I don't know that much about sushi but the group I was with does.  Remarks from the crowd, "top notch", "the waiter knows whats up", "great presentation", "best value in town".  That says it all.  The only thing missing for me was more atmosphere.  It felt a little like I may as well have been sitting in a doctor's office.  Overall it gets 4 stars.

10-4-2013 1700 (5pm) Friday 8 people in the restaurant. Was placed at a table and immediately noticed the table was filthy, look around and others in the same shape. Not dishes, food residue on the table. Ask busboy to clean uses a very wet cloth a couple of swipes and leaves the table wet. Mad because he had to do his job. Ordered Calamari fish was not cooked. Ordered sashimi dinner salmon was very old tried to cover it up with lemon slices. While I was eating the chef started some fish in the salamander about two minutes, then was told wrong order so he pulled out laid it on the back counter. A little later chef put it back in salamander and served it to someone else. There is food on walls, food on chairs, fish not stored at proper temperatures. Pre made starters wrapped in Saran Wrap about ten out in the open on the back of counter. I was up half the night with bowl problems.  The worst thing about this experience, I have been going there since it opened. This OWNER takes, but doesn't put anything back into the business. It is very popular, but someone is going to get very sick. City and county FOOD inspectors  need to come inspect now.

On point customer service the food is good ! Nice environment.  Highly recommend if you don't feel like going to the strip and spending stupid amounts of money.  Plus side is all you can drink sake n bud light
The head chef left.  Sushi & service suffers terribly.

Love coming here. The staff is friendly and their food is very good. I choose not to do AYCE sushi because of the short time limit and I'd have to eat waaay too much to get my monies worth (possibly a good thing for some).

I thought I would never find better AYCE sushi than in Reno, NV, but after making the move back to Las Vegas (okay NLV) I was stoked to discover Sushi Tachi. For being desert style sushi, it is delicious and the service their could not be better. I can expect to find a friendly smile and some seriously good sushi. My friends will even venture from their west side to join us here!

Customer Service: Great! Young lady was very courteous and attentive.  Atmosphere and decor: Staff should wipe the menu down. Just because they're laminated does not mean it's disinfected. Decor was modern and clean. There was a funny egg smell when we first walked in.   Food: -Shoyu Ramen was salty and took 20 mins -Fried calamari tasted like old crunchy grease -Curry bowl was great -Veggie roll was decent  Will not be coming back. Go to sushi house Goyemon instead.

Awesome service! The atmosphere is very welcoming and servers are super friendly! The fish was very fresh, loved the seared salmon. You can order half rolls too, so you're able to try more. Definitely recommend the all you can eat because they have a variety of different rolls that are a must try like the Moon River Roll :)

Sushi Tachi is a great place, they are my favorite place not only for sushi, but my favorite restaurant in general. They are also a great value $26 for all you can eat for dinner plus $2 for a drink including refills, I always eat a ton, their sushi is delicious.  I've been to other sushi places that have similar offers around Las Vegas, but their sushi isn't as good as the sushi you get at Sushi Tachi. Something else I would add is that when you're in a group you can share only if you all order all you can eat.   When I arrived at the parking lot I heard Katy Perry playing, they have speakers that play music outside of their restaurant, I found this welcoming. At the front I was greeted and quickly seated with a party I was meeting, a waiter asked me for my drink and brought it to me very quickly. A waitress then took my order, I started off with Uni, I found it pleasing, it tastes a bit like oyster, but pasty instead of slimy in case you've never had it before. After I ate my Uni, I ordered the Lisa Lisa roll, it has hot tempura shrimp next to cream cheese on the inside which warms it up, which is then complimented with the cold, sticky, sweet sushi rice on the outside, dip it in soy sauce to add that extra salty element that dances on your taste buds. I also tried something new, I didn't know what it was at first, a friend of mine ordered it. It turns out it was the New York Girl in Vegas, it was amazing. As I chewed into it, I felt the sticky, the firm salmon, the creamy avocado and the creamy and spicy mayo. I swallowed and something hit me, something citrusy, I was caught off guard, it adds a lot of bright notes to the roll, I loved it and will order it next time I go.  I love this place overall, one complaint would be that I wish the waitress would walk by more often so that we could order more food, the food can also take a while to all come out, but it's worth the wait. I strongly recommend checking this place out if you haven't. Try the Lisa Lisa roll, the Tachi #2, a lot of my friends favorite, and the New York Girl you'll love them.

Well, several months ago my rating would have been much higher, but the last time we went, the service was much slower and the sushi not as good.  We do like the AYCE days, and we take advantage of it.  Even with slow service, it is worth it, because we EAT SUSHI - a lot of it, and everything on their menu, even the $15 special rolls are included with the AYCE.  We usually go on the days when it includes wine or beer, and it is definitely worth the price.  We are traditionalists and therefore don't usually eat the Americanized cream cheese and avocado stuffed rolls, and it's harder to ruin the standard fish and rice sushi.  But some of the rolls being served are gorgeous.  All the cooked things I have had, yakitori, hamachi kama, etc. have been very good!  I have to say that every time we have been there, the fish has been fresh, but the care going into it and the little touches (like making it pretty) just haven't been there.  They don't use wasabi in their sushi either, which is strange.  I guess I could ask them to do, but we just put it into our soy sauce and dip the sushi in it.  Needless to say, we will be going back.

Just finished eating at sushi tachi    The customer service here is wonderful! I didn't catch our servers name, but my receipt says her name is 0001? Lol She makes funny little jokes, which makes me want to come back. The service was fast even though the entire place was packed. Only one table open.  All in all this place was great! It's the third time I've been here and its still good. Oh and don't forget your frequent buyer card!

I will have a spicy tuna roll with a side of racism. My family and I went to Sushi Tachi a few months ago and it has taken me this long to calm the rage from the experience to write my review.  One evening my husband,  daughter and I went out to AYCE at Sushi Tachi. We walked in, sat down and began ordering. My daughter had brought in a Disney Princess doll to keep her occupied. Dinner went on and we were getting odd service from one of the waitresses. My husband and I simply thought she was just a naturally unhappy person and that is simply "how her face always looked."  The odd unhappy waitress came over at one point and asked my daughter to see her doll. The waitress said, "that is a pretty doll, is it Cinderella? ." My daughter corrected her and said, "no it is Sophia the First." The waitresses response, "oh, well she is white just like every Disney Princess." She then walked away from the table. My husband and I looked at each other in shock. We finally arrived at dessert. I ordered green tea ice cream and my husband ordered a tempura vanilla ice cream. When the waitress brought our order she gave me my green tea ice cream and as she placed my husband's order down she said and I quote, "here is your vanilla, vanilla." My husband a little confused asked her what she said. The odd, unhappy, smug waitress repeated, "here is your vanilla, VANILLA!"  Well, as you can imagine we will never be back.
This is the best sushi place ever. Staff is great & food is fresh & exceptional. I would highly recommend this place to everyone that loves good sushi!!!!!  Yummy, yummy goodness.

Sushi was good, teriyaki and chicken bowl were greasy but the worst part was the service. We only saw our servers when they brought our food. We repeatedly had to try and flag them down for refills or napkins. It eventually got to the point where we had to get up and find them everytime we needed something. After we ate, we waited at least twenty minutes for them to bring our check.  I'd give this place one star if it weren't for the sushi.
My favorite place to go the staff is always the best and it never takes long to get our sushi... the HAWAIIAN ROLL & STACY ROLL are the best
This place was great, sushi was top notch, service was even better. For being from out of town, I had no idea what to expect but was very happy.
Love it best Sushi in Vegas sexy girl my favorite roll Sukura followed right behind baked green muscles 5 star great costumer service. Top 5 places to eat in Vegas!

Not too bad for your little around the corner neighborhood sushi spot. Been here more than a few times. Good for something quick, but I've had better. Great service though. Can get pretty slammed with families and babies... it is a neighborhood spot!
Great sushi, service,  and atmosphere! Love their tuna lovers roll and the monthly special roll.

This is the best sushi place in North Las Vegas. It's a God-send. I have always received top-notch service and it never ceases to satisfy my sushi cravings.   My only critique is they don't seem to have spent as much attention on the decor as they have their wonderful service and tasty food. It's just not much to look at, that's all.  "All you can eat" prices are fair--$26 for lunch and $29 for dinner and that includes all the Bud Light and sake you can drink. I've run up on the time limit and the staff was very polite by letting me know I'm getting close and they would take any additional orders I had cause they didn't want to charge me extra.  I've had the AYCE at least a dozen times here and I've never had anything I didn't like. Easily worth driving even 15 minutes for!
Great, really. Good service, even better prices--great sushi. Try the rock and roll, and fried Philadelphia roll. Awesome.

When I was out in the Las Vegas area I used to go to this sushi bar quite often. One of the benefits of eating here was the made-to-order, all you can eat sushi specials during lunch time. I wonder if they still have this going but if you were looking for a cheap sushi meal, then go no further. However, I've definitely had better sushi in my life before (I've been to Japan twice, and there is a great sushi bar in Kansas City, MO which is excellent.)
Great little neighborhood sushi place. Nothing special; it's gets the job done.  Warning: the 911 roll is CRAZY hot. Seriously spicy.

This is probably the best value sushi you will find.  It's definitely not Nobu but the quality is good and the price is great.  The all-you-can-eat special is fantastic.  I don't know how they make money off of it.

The continuous quest for decent sushi in the desert brought me here.  Located on the SE corner of Simmons and Centennial, the location is convenient for me, so I just had to try it.  Sushi Tachi has the standard tonkatsu, teriyaki, tempura, sushi, and udon.  They also have an AYCE menu, for $25.95 for 1 hour.  I am very skeptical of AYCE sushi, but surprisingly this place is a solid 3.5 stars!  The sumeshi was on the mushy side, maybe they put a little too much water in the rice cooker today.  But, the portions were surprisingly generous, especially for AYCE!  (I was expecting monsterous-sized nigiri, topped with a wafer-thin slice of fish.)  Our waitress was Thai and a little slow, but one of the Japanese waitresses took our second round order, when I jokingly said I wanted uni and amaebi (the limited sushi menu did not list these items), she asked the Japanese sushi chef if they had uni and amaebi, and he responded with a, "Hai! Motteru!" Wow. I asked if they had otoro, and the sushi chef said, "mottenai".  Too bad, I guess you can't win them all!  She then asked if we wanted the amaebi heads fried...I jokingly looked at her like, "duh!" and she laughed and wrote my order down LOL. Yay!  Now I knew I was going to get my money's worth!  This place is actually not bad for the price, much better than Sushi Wow on Simmons and Ann.  They do, however limit the uni, amaebi, sake shooter, and fried oyster to one order per customer.  (I guess that's fair, because people like me will just place an order for 20 Uni sushis LOL)  They also have a stamper card, so when you buy 10 AYCE meals, the 11th one is free!  I will definitely be coming back when I feel like pigging out!  Update 5/15: I have been going to Sushi Tachi pretty regularly, and this place still is a solid 3.5 stars in my book!  They didn't have Uni the last time I was there, but they had toro and kobe beef!  Yum!  Don't mind the cheezy 80's rock music they play there LOL!

Service: Horrible.   Ordered our dishes. We saw our dishes ready. Waiteress left her shift,  out the door she went without saying anything to us. Maybe they speak no English?!?  and didn't even give us our sushi.   Waited around. Called another worker over and we asked him to give us our sushi that's 2 feet away. I guess he became our waiter. The hubby asked for ice cream. It never came. Had to ask again. Note-there was barely anybody there.   FOOD: Meh. Not as flavorful sushi as the ones I've had in San Diego. The 'finish-every-grain-of-rice-else-you're-buying-the-whole-roll' is quite intimidating. They try to get you full off their rice so you want to order more cause your full of rice!  The mussels and seared fish were good.   Mochi for dessert is awesome except you only get ONE even though it's an AYCE. Lame.     They lag and suck at customer service(waiters that is). Quality mediocre.  No thanks for $60 between us.
Friendly service. nice little sushi place. Maybe some more tvs, & some good music to liven up the atmosphere a little. Need a little more all you can eat options, I went through them all already.
Been here a bunch off times now. Consistently provided good food and great service. Even when they are very busy.

I like the rolls it's super yummy! I think the coolest part is I came down on a Tuesday and they were doing all-you-can-drink beer and sake in addition to their AYCE sushi. I'll definitely be back again!

The go-to all you can sushi place in Vegas.  After my husband introduced me to this place, I've been a fan ever since.    For a while we would double date with another couple and the sushi chef started recognizing us and would send over off the menu creations that were delish!  Everyone who works here is really nice.    If you go on certain days of the week it's all you can eat sushi and also all you can drink beer or sake.
We usually go to Sushi Tachi on Wednesdays to enjoy the all you can eat and all you can drink. Our favorites are Gone with the Wind and Haru!

i didnt like it at all.. i read some of the reviews and they were all saying its good but when i went it was so expensive and the food wasnt all that great. ive been to a better all you can eat sushi place before and they were way cheaper and had more variety. the lunch was 25 and the other place i went to lunch was 15 and had oysters and raw food. this place doesnt give u oysters till dinner. the other place is sushi kaya try there is better and worth the drive. its off spring mountain and arville.

I have to say that this AYCE sushi restaurant is sublime! I literally stuffed myself until I could not continue to eat. This is something that I don't get to do often so it is a very satisfying feeling knowing that I can fill my belly!  It's always a treat being able to go to a place that is all you can eat; however, when you think of it...quality doesn't come to mind. I usually go to all you can eat sushi restaurants with lower expectations but this place is definitely an exception! Delicious! The sushi is fresh and the quality is definitely not what I expected!   I don't really enjoy Vegas but I will definitely be stopping by here again  if I'm ever in the area!

Great sushi spot tucked away in the south east corner, next to EOS gym. Have a carb load after leg day :) Staff are kind and the sushi chefs are fast. I've had their All You Can Eat, which is a great selection. Wish they had a steak sushi though. I've also ordered out and they were fast with my order. Definitely my go to sushi spot on the north side of town.
Great service, very nice employees and the Sushi Rocks! You don't have to order from the menu only they will customize your rolls the way you like without attitude.

I love this place! it's only 5 min. away from my house. My husband and I always go here we have been going here for about 4 years now lol. I love the sushi ALL YOU CAN EAT they say it's 60 min. but I know I've been there longer.They do half rolls if you are too full to eat a whole one. We usually bring my daughter and she's allergic to fish so it is a good think they have things other than fish on their menu. The staff is super nice and very helpful. Our cups are never empty when ever we come here.me and my family are usually there like 3 times a month.Plus they added my favorite dessert TEMPURA ICE cream they only have one flavor Vanilla.
I love this  place!! Come here every time we crave sushi. I can never complain!!  fresh good quality food

Sushi wasn't bad (though I didn't think there was variety like I've seen other places), better than expected but the service was lacking. No one offered to fill my water until after we got our bill. We had to sit at the bar cause they were so busy and the sushi chef wasn't personable. He made no eye contact whatsoever and we ordered a roll he mumbled a response and we weren't sure he even got it right. I probably won't go again but if you need a quick fix and don't want to drive far give it a shot.
Hole in a wall place I found near my house.  Brought my family here that was visiting from Alaska and they loved it!  Everyone is nice and friendly!

I have been going here for years. So, of course, I'm going to go for my last week in Vegas. My advice is not to sit at the bar on a weekend. It was hard to order food as they were constantly busy. The food was great as always. My favorite us the super white.
Still my favorite sushi in this area. We love their cajun tuna. My family has always had good luck with the freshest fish.
I'm came back what's up  Hungry eat 4roll I'm full so good Thanks guys see you soon

Harold is gone.  We won't be back.  He did all the ordering and now I am no longer confident that the fish will be the same quality.  You have all been warned.  I was told someone got sick off the salmon this week after Chef Haru was gone.  It also would not be the same without him serving my sushi.

We used to eat here a lot over the course of 4 years. But slowly the quality of food and service had deteriorated. We waited too long to get our food, come to find out our sever forgot our order. Since we had ordered AYCE we have plates piling up. We have stacked our plates on one side of the table so it will be easier for the server to clear it. But, they didn't even bother to pick it up. The only thing that we got fast was when we asked for the check. Definitely...you guys lost our business. We will never come back.

Our party of seven went for the all-you-can-eat lunch on a recent Saturday.  For some reason, we weren't feeling much love from the staff, even though we were the only ones seated at the theretofore empty counter/bar and the tables were only half filled.  Believe me, we're definitely not a bunch of jerks that might elicit such a reception, which maybe means we tend to be a bit too sensitive about such things as attentive, friendly service.  But it's also a bit ironic that the all-Japanese staff should also know that they wouldn't be forgiven for such shabby service, say, in Tokyo.  The young sushi chef who was serving us for some reason seemed to be in an especially unpleasant mood--almost as if he was doing us a big favor by taking our orders (Itamaesan no taido wa mazukatta!).  Nonetheless, the sushi itself was not half bad.  Perhaps for many people food quality mitigates poor service but I have to question whether it was worth driving up to the edge of nowhere for such a chilly reception, especially when you've already traveled 2,800 miles to Vegas from Honolulu!  A bit disappointing as this was our second visit with more or less the same group and we had been looking forward to dining there based on our initial, more positive experience at the restaurant.
Excellent service, excellent food. For a sushi restaurant, rice will make or break your business and the rice here is impeccable. Just the right amount of bite without being soggy. Great food.

I went here with my boyfriend after reading all the nice reviews here on Yelp. I didn't have high expectations, but I did expect some level of tasty sushi expectation. Wanting to satisfy our sushi cravings and for a close to home spot to eat it, we ventured out to this little place on a Friday night around 7pm. Unfortunately, yelpers totally missed the mark this time. Don't worry I still rely on and like you fellow yelpers.   Service was good. They were attentive for when my glass was  empty and refilled it quickly. Clean and spacious place. Even had a TV mounted on the wall. Normally I'm used to the loud, crowded, sometimes chaotic sushi joints where the bar is filled up and everyone's having a good time. Chopsticks clacking, glasses hitting the table lightly. It was really quiet for a spacious place with no real energy or atmosphere. Not too big a deal.  When I went, there were sports jerseys on the walls. The walls were largely empty save for the jersey decor, there wasn't exactly any charm to the place. A little silly, but again definitely not a big deal, after all, we were here for the food.   We were the only ones at the bar despite the fact that it did have other groups there at the tables. It was a little awkward sitting there with people staring at us and with murmurs of conversation.   The sushi didn't taste fresh. Exactly as how another reviewer said, this might be the "fast food" of sushi. It was okay. Dry. Bland taste. Not all that delicious. Had most of the rolls. Salmon, yellowtail, eel, California roll etc. In no way am I picky eater at all. Far from it! I'm not one of those sushi-purists that are finicky eaters who crave fine dining. Lol I'm not a sushi snob. Just a sushi lover and not too hard to please. But really, this place was mediocre even for an AYCE choice. Nothing to rave about, much less recommend.   I'm happy this place seems to  have a good following. I'm all for a  local business thriving especially for a sushi place you don't have to drive miles and miles for. Unfortunately, Sushi Tachi won't be my sushi paradise.

This is our go to sushi restaurant. Eat here at least twice a month. Have tried numerous other sushi places that offer ayce and this is the best. The service is great, everything looks and tastes amazing, and they offer all you can drink bud light and house sake. My recommendation is the orion roll and the sexy girl.

I love sushi and have tried many different sushi places but decided to give this place a shot, WORST mistake. I was really disappointed with not only the quality but the plating. I do believe people overhype this place a little too much or have just never tried GOOD sushi before. I usually don't post how bad the food is I just don't bother to go again, but not only was I upset at the food but the fact that I tried to beat it on time for lunch which still costs more than some better sushi spots on the strip which is 24.95 for lunch. First of all, the rolls had too much rice! The fish was unevenly cut, the rolls had no sauce nor garnishes that made it taste bland and look boring. The nigiri was the worst! The fish was too thick and chewy and had no flavor. I ordered the calamari and definitely was not what I expected. It was like three shrimp tempura looking things with terrible batter mix they used, they were not even crunchy but soggy. It made me not want to try any fried rolls since I'd probably lose my appetite even more. They didn't offer a variety of sushi bar sides but they did have a good variety of appetizers which my friend did enjoy since he doesn't like fish. Lastly, the dessert was only a choice of green tea ice cream or cookies and cream. For the price and quality I was paying I was definitely expecting something better like their special desserts which is only for dinner but should be offered all the time since better sushi spots like yama, gorilla, or goyeman have a better variety and quality for better or same price. Moral of the story, if it's gonna be your first time trying sushi, pick a different spot so you're not disappointed and never want to eat sushi again

First time at a sushi restaurant in years and was a can't miss experience.  Exemplary service, excellent cuisine, extraordinary sushi joint. I don't post to Yelp hardly ever and this place was worth talking about. Enjoy the experience Yelpers!!!
The best sushi place for me by far in the northside. Hope you guys get to try this place out.
Man, I used to love this place because of Haru, the mad genius sushi chef extraordinaire from Spain.. But now it's just ok.  I give it 3.25 stars

Best sushi I've had that wasn't right next to the ocean with fresh catch. Nice clean taste.  Curry was amazing.  Staff was helpful, service could have been a bit better, had a stack of plates that never got cleared.  We will be going back!!

I have to say that this place is also OK. The location is what makes it great. Not a lot of Japanese restaurants in this neck of the woods. The service has always been consistently good; I would rate it 8/10. The chefs are nice and friendly. The lunch specials here are affordable. The sushi quality is good compared to the cost. I hate it when people complain about quality if it is cheap. People have to run a business and make money. I am always aware of that fact. Overall, this place is a great little sushi restaurant.

Tried this place for the first time today and I will never go back. We arrived at 6 PM and immediately ordered 2 rolls and a side of chicken teriyaki. The AYCE has a 60 minute limit. Our rolls were not brought out until 6:30. The server brought the chicken teriyaki and then realized he brought the meal size portion so took it away. Taste was very bland. We ordered more rolls and 2 orders of shrimp tempura. At 6:45 we saw a man who just sat down being served 2 orders of shrimp tempura. We asked our server about it (since clearly they were ours) and he claimed to remember us ordering them and offered to put in an order then. We decided to leave. We spent $66 and left hungry. The service was absolutely horrible. The female server we had did not know if they served wine. all of the employees seemed to have an attitude and acted like it was a hassle to take orders or serve food.

The worst AYCE place I ever been to, this place is "all you can WAIT", first they forced us to order their hot food. Which we didn't. And then When we Ordered their sushi it took more than half an hour. Plus their service is awful. I will Never Ever go to this place again. Try it if u wanna waste your money.

love this place with all my heart. always have a wonderful experience when i am here! the servers always do their best to check on you and they're all pretty young. have had some bad experiences with older servers in sushi restaurants but the ones here will not disappoint! try the 911 roll, most places are just drenched in some hot sauce but the 911 here actually has flavor which I love. tried salmon roe for the first time here as well and it was delish! :) took off one star because I was left unattended one day when it was busy but I am forgiving. :)
Huge selection, great deals, ayce lives up to its name.  Add free bud light and sake!! (Sunday thru wed with ayce)  I'll be back and would definitely recommend.

sushi yeaaa!! i love theyre lunch specials! they also have green tea ice cream! The food is amazing and the service is relatively good. The food def keeps me coming back. The atmosphere is very nice and intimate, great for girls night out or date night with the hubby :)

I went there yesterday with my son. We were craving sushi for quite some time now. At first I thought it was a bit pricy. We ordered the all you can eat dinner. It wasn't very busy at the time so we got excellent service from the chefs and wait staff. The food was excellent and we left stuffed.  The staff mentioned specials that we will definitely take advantage of in the future. As a Hawaiian I know good sushi and this was exceptional!

4 stars instead of 5 because of the service. It took a while for the waitress to bring around my drinks and no one checked on me while eating. The sushi however was very good. Came alone on Saturday night and there was plenty of room at the bar for me.
Dined in here 3 times nice little hole in the wall, service was good and sushi just decent , will go back if in the area.
A great deal. Best All You Can Eat Sushi in the Northwest part of Las Vegas. I love the New Year's Eve Roll!! crunchy. Sushi chefs are nice and personable. AYCE and drink is also awesome!!

The sushi is excellent. The only reason I don't give five stars is because, in peak hours, the service can be rather slow. This is still my preferred sushi on the north side of town. Very tasty. Very good value. I do wish they would hire one more chef and one more server.

One of the best sushi places I have ever eaten at. The New York Girl in Vegas is amazing, and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We always get the AYCE and then a separate dinner for our youngest son.  One night he was feeling a little "sad" that he was not eating a roll, and they took some chicken katsu, carrot, cucumber and rice and rolled it up in soy paper for him.  Now, that is service! Unless we are in a larger group than 4, we always sit at the bar. Don't forget when you are there, to ask your chef what HIS specialty is!

Absolutely love the food here! My only complaint would be that when it's busy I feel like they get overwhelmed and everything kind of goes wrong with the order or it never comes out. I always come when it's slow, then they're great!
Great jewel off the strip. Really fresh and friendly chefs. Def coming back.

Left my wallet here, came back 15m later. Table cleared and our waitress was gone no where to be found. Asked the front and waited for her for 20m he said her shift is over and she isn't here. I really liked this place too. Will speak with manager on Monday. Waitress was kind of annoyed with sudden rush hour, but wouldn't think she would take my wallet.

I came here because the comments were pretty convincing. The sushi rolls were bland. The only roll I can remember and liked was the Tachi roll #2. Not to mention, they charged my 9 year old as an adult because she is tall. She clearly has not hit puberty yet. Her father is 6'3 and I am 5'8. I've been to multiple sushi restaurants with better prices for children and flavors all around. I'd rather Kaya Sushi or Kaizen on deer springs. First and last visit for me. The servers were pretty nice.

I used to come to this sushi place very often, and it used to have pretty good sushi, but over the past 2 years sushi tachi has gotten progressively worse. They do have an AYCE and its in line with most AYCE sushi. The sushi here is really honestly bad. I had the all you can eat here (for the last time) the other day. Every roll that they brought was warm (and not on purpose) the fish was disgusting. Even the edamame was gross! The service was also bad it literally took the server 20 minutes to come over and ask what we wanted to drink and then another 10 minutes to get our drinks and put our sushi orders in we waited over an hour to get any food at all! And when they brought our first couple of rolls half of them were not what we ordered! Then the lady argued that we did order it. Finally she took the food back and brought us what we wanted, which still tasted bad.  I think they've had a change of staff or something but regardless your employees should be properly trained. The two tables next to us also had issues with their food. I wish I could say anything good about this place but if I were you I'd stay away.
Good food with good quality, great service! If you looking for some sushi with budget, this restaurant would work for you for sure!! One of my favorite restaurant.

Went there tonight and my wife and I stood there for 15 minutes and were not acknowledged. This place has been our go to since 2010. But tonight we were force to try Kaizen up the road and we were impressed with the variety of the rolls and the options that surpassed Sushi Tachi. We will miss our "Picket Bitch" and "Chi-Chi" rolls but we are impressed with Kaizen.

Been eating at Sushi Tach since the last review in 2012 and recently they have replace the menu's that I notice some reviewers were complaining about well used dirty menu's. Me I never had a problem with the menu being dirty but to put your mind at ease I noticed they have replaced them with new ones. As always AYCE was wonderful. clean facility and friendly staff. I tried the Sake Shooter and OMG I had 2 of them. Ahe Poke is out of this world. Oh and if there is something you don't want, like light on the sauce just ask. When trying a Roll, order a half roll and if you like it order a whole one. Ask and Ye Shall receive, stay silent and get average menu items. everything is as advertised but communication as with anything will make your meal much better. If you want a 911 and tell the chef you want it hotter he will make your toes curl up, be careful what you ask for you might get it :)

My daughter and I love Sushi Tachi.  The service is good and the food is even better. My daughter is 6 & we both do the all you can eat sushi which includes shu mai, chicken terriyaki, edamame and many other dishes my daughter loves. The sushi is fresh and made to order and the staff are great!!!

Had a great time as always here!! One of my favorite all you can eat sushi a bars in town! If you haven't tried it you must! Super friendly staff and shorter then normal wait times on everything! Always have the freshest fish and mouth watering dishes. Try the yellowtail collar one of my favorites

The service was awful. Everything looked rushed and plating was not par. The servers were stressed because there were only two of them on the weekend dinner rush. And 60 mins all you can  eat time limit with 15 minute wait times between plates? What a joke. Kaizen runs laps around this place.

We really love this place!  We have been going here for a few years now and the food is always on point and the service is impeccable.  Even when we can't make the all you can eat sushi, we love to place to go orders for dinner and once again, our orders are always 100% fresh and correct with zero issues at all. Furthermore, it has always been ready by the time they have promised, even on the busiest of nights and weekends.  My only gripe is that we usually bring our kids.  Last summer we brought our 3 year old who can obviously barely finish two pieces of sushi if he's really hungry.  We told our server that he was 3 and usually just grazes off of our plate.  She said they had a rule where he had to be a certain height against one of their counters.  I cringed because my son is in size 5 clothes and is always mistaken for being much older, but you can tell by his language that he is definitely not that age.  Well, he of course measured higher than the counter.  I offered to show his birth certificate that I had coincidentally had on hand after registering him for school and they said it didn't matter, they had to do a height test.  So bizarre lol!  So we paid for him to eat a two piece of the sashimi.  Didn't seem right at all, but we have still continued to order.

Got the all you can eat,  and they over rice everything.  Rice,  rice,  and more rice.  Ordered the super white tuna (ono),  seared salmon, octopus,  garlic tuna and yellow tail nigiri sushi,   they all came out warm with a thick ball of rice each and incredibly unseasoned,  no flavor what so ever. The ocean roll,  sunset roll,  and the yellowtail mambo all are exactly the same,  yet the descriptions are all different.  The garlic ponzu tastes like soy sauce.  The deep fried Shrimp heads tasted of old frying oil.   This place is crowded, we waited for a spot at the bar.  I thought crowded restaurant meant that people really like it.  Maybe they like the all you can drink Bud Light.  I looked around the restaurant, and  everyone was Caucasian.    Anyway I noticed that all the rolls coming out looked exactly the same.   Why would anyone give this place anything higher than  2 stars?  Have they not had proper sushi before?  Does this place not know what sashimi is?  Has the world gone mad?

I do love this restraunt its currently the "close to home favorite" but the last time I went I was kinda turned off. The man who was preparing my rolls was touching and playing with his cellphone bare handed then proceeded to make my roll without washing his hands or wearing gloves. Phones carry so much bacteria on them I was actually grossed out. I know people like messing with their phones but dont be playing with ur dirty phone while ur making my food bro.!

If you're in the North side, looking for AYCE sushi, then this is your spot. But if you have the chance to travel somewhere else, then I suggest you do so. Sushi is delicious here but service is a big deal if you're going to interact with them every 10 minutes or so. Ate here twice already, once with just my boyfriend & I then the second time with his whole family. Both occasions were different servers & both were not attentive, nice or friendly.  You need better servers for AYCE, just saying. But food was yummy. Will only try it again if I'm craving AYCE sushi & I'm in the North side.

Every time my sister comes to visit, we hit up a AYCE sushi joint. Last monday, this was the spot. It was $26.95 which comes w/bud light and the house sake for 60 mins.   Here is what we had:  3 buds and 2 large sakes spicy tuna hand roll w/masago and a quail egg (me only) 2 orders of ahi poke 1 order of raw tofu 2 orders of salmon and 2 orders hamachi 2 orders of amaebi w/deep fried heads 1/2 of a roll that i forget the name 1 sake shooter (me only) 2 baked scallops 1 salmon collar 1 order of the cajun albacore and 1 order of tako 1/2 roll of new york girl in vegas 1 green tea ice cream 1 pink colored ice cream which i forget the flavor  The food was very good. The fish was fresh. Our sushi chef was the older japanese man. He was great. The waitresses were nice. The place was clean. I'll probably come by myself next time I'm craving sushi when my sister isn't in town. We came here for an early dinner so I was disappointed that I wasn't able to eat more. Great AYCE spot hidden in North Las Vegas.  My sister's one complaint was that the bar stools were too low. Yeah they were a little low.

I went there with my kids, teenagers, we were seated right away, the hostess was friendly and courteous. We ordered 3 Bento Box, two chicken and the other steak. It came with rice, the meat, California roll, one had pot stickers, salad and miso soup, all good. We also got a couple of sushi on the side, salmon skin roll and a crunchy roll, both were really good. The all-you-can-eat sushi would have been ideal but we weren't as hungry. The price for both were reasonable compared to the other sushi restaurants in Vegas. We have gone back several times and the food still taste very good.

The service and food is nearly perfect! I have never had a bad meal here and it continues to be one of my favorite places to go. The prices are great and the food is so fresh. It is also a very clean restuarant. The only reason I didn't give it a perfect score was because the bathroom is in a odd area of the resturant. You have to actually walk into the kitchen to reach the restroom. Other than that, it is awesome!
I live right around the corner from Sushi Tachi and love coming here (I'm sitting in a booth right now). The AYCE menu is a big one and a fair price and the staff is a really nice group of people:-)
Been coming here for years... Love the all you can eat menu! A decent price for awesome sushi!
Very small place, but well worth a stop. Great all you can eat sushi.  Very friendly service.  Try the Chi Chi Rolls. Our favorite sushi on the North side.
Good sushi places are very limited in the area, so after trying other places, we always end up back here.  They're not always consistent, but they satisfy the last minute cravings.

Love that Bud Light and house sake are included in AYCE Sun-Wed. That, and pretty decent AYCE sushi for NLV makes it awesome!!! Yes, I do have a AYCE sushi in Vegas that I like better, but I live soooo much closer to this place..... An easy 4 stars in my book!  Fresh raw fish is my main criteria!

Solid sushi place if you're looking for your sushi fix. Not the best sushi i've had by any means, but the Rock'NRoll and the Cristina Roll are good with a little bit of eel sauce drizzled on top. If you've never tried sushi before, know that this place is only average in terms of taste and if you don't like it, don't give up on sushi. Have also had other items on the menu besides the sushi and it's also good food. Great wait staff. Awesome service.

Boyfriend and I ventured here at the reccomendation of a family member and its close to home. We usually stick to one sushi spot and wanted to try something new.   After sitting down we noticed the other sushi rolls that were being served, they didnt look all that delicious, so we decided to play it safe and order two half rolls to see if we even would like it. We ordered the 911 roll, which made us both want to call 911. Was SPICY as advertised but presentation was horrible, the roll looked more like a square and was squished at the ends. WTH? The only thing that stood out about that roll was that it set our mouth on fire. Nothing else signficant about it, was not "tasty" at all. I should have just took a shot of Siracha hot sauce instead. We also ordered one of the Tachi rolls. It was okay. Better than the 911 roll, it had some taste. Lastly we ordered garlic tuna sushi...which was missing the key ingredient...the GARLIC sauce! It had just a minute drizzle on each piece. FAIL. We ended up leaving and going to our regular sushi spot.   That staff however was very polite, quick service, and all smiles.   Lesson learned, the grass was not greener on the other side for us.  BLAH!

I came here on a giant sushi craving. It was okay. I wouldn't come back because there really wasn't anything special.   We had the boat sushi and it was okay. The fish was good it did satisfy my sushi craving, but I'd rather go some place else to satisfy my craving.

Randomly went here while hungry and in the area!  Had the all you can eat, which is a good value for almost anyone who can eat a decent amount.  We went on a Saturday and therefore they didn't have their all you can drink, which if you drink seems like an excellent value.  Now the sushi is very mediocre in my opinion.  Would probably go back one more time to try the all you can eat and drink special.  Hopefully the sushi is better.  I think that you don't get the same portion for an all u can eat vs a regular a la carte portion?  I don't think this place merits 4.5 stars though for sure!!  3 seems right, 4 is pushing it.....

I go here ONLY for the chicken Cutlet curry, which is 99% on point with coco ichibanya in japan. It is the closest thing we can find as military members to treat us like we are in Japan still. Even though I can drive 4-5 hours to california for the actual coco ichibanya, this is the next best thing. Sushi is also delicious there!!!

One of the best sushi spots in Vegas! Where should I begin...  I don't eat sushi much. And if I do eat sushi its only the cooked/deep fried selections I'll eat. But on this visit, I was the sushi master!! Everything from tuna to soft shell crab, salmon to eel, and even a bit of yellowtail. I swear the menu had about 100 different sushi items to choose from and I've probably made it through 20 so I'll be back to claim my crown and throne from this sushi warrior challooonge (challenge)!  To get the bang for ya buck, you have to go for the All You Can Eat sushi deal for $24.99. That includes unlimited sushi and bud light or sake. Let's just say we indulged ourselves into pure bliss. Baked salmon hand wraps, spicy tuna tempura rolls, and deep fried eel rolls are bomb.com! The only downer about this place is that its small. The sushi bar area can sit maybe 10 people and the dinning area is decent. The tv's stay on ESPN but no.volume just closed caption.  The only way to enjoy this review to its perfect extent is to put on those lose jeans/gym shorts, prepare your appetite, and get your fanny down to Sushi Tachi and get your grub on! Lol.

All i have to say is the food there is exceptional my wife and i always get the all you can eat sushi from sunday-thursday because not only is it all you can eat sushi and some kitchen items its all you can drink bud light and house saki but friday and saturday this offer for the beer and saki is not available. the sushi itself is very fresh and the staff are very friendly and get you your food quickly for kitchen items. And if you plan on going back be sure to get a stamp card for the all you can eat sushi.
Our go to sushi spot!!! We are regulars and love the food and service! If you love sushi this is definitely a must try!

My boyfriend and I go to this place because it's his absolute favorite! He's been going for years and I recently started joining. The sushi chefs know him the moment he walks through the door and remember his order every time for all you can eat. They have amazing service and so personalized.   I don't like sushi because I don't like raw fish. However, their menu has a lot of options for cooked rolls and you even have the option to order a half a roll. This is great for me! I order the rock n roll, jj roll, and lisa lisa and I love them! Each filled with different things like tempura shrimp, crab, cream cheese, asparagus, etc. The cooked mussels are my favorite so flavorful and fresh! They also have plenty of options from the kitchen such as edamame, calamari, teriyaki chicken, etc.   The pricing is reasonable, $26 for lunch or $29 for dinner. The restaurant is tiny and is somewhat hidden next to an EOS Gym but it is very popular. There is one large table you can fit up to about 20 but the remaining tables seat about 4 people. I highly suggest stopping in for AYCE!

I have to say I love this sushi restaurant. It's $26.95 for all you can eat at dinner time, but the food is very good.  You also get free all you can drink bud light on Sundays and Mondays (I have never had it, but its nice to have the offer).  I really have no complaints about this place.  I usually eat here about once a month and every time it has been an enjoyable experience.
Always great food and service!   Come here regularly and will continue.  There are many sushi restaurants in the area, and I've tried most of them.  This place is the best.

One of my favorite sushi places for all-you-can-eat! They even have all-you-can-drink sake on certain nights. The chefs are always nice and friendly. We always recommend Sushi Tachi and try to take friends here when sushi is what we are craving!

I love his place! Employees and chefs are always nice and on top of it. I go here often and haven't had a bad experience yet. The all you can eat says 1 hour but we always stay longer and haven't been rushed out ever. It also says  on certain days but we've gone in on everyday of the week and got the all you can eat deal. It included all items on the menu even from the kitchen and bud light and saki. You couldn't ask for more from a sushi bar!

We normally go to another place in the Aliante area. Thought we'd try Sushi Tachi for something new.  It was so so.  The service was horrible. It took 20 minutes for someone to come to our table. We all ordered AYCE.  It took 30 minutes for our first roll to come.  And that was just one persons roll. We only had one roll each by the time the hour was up. The server tried telling us that she was going to have to charge us for the extra rolls that we had ordered since our time was up.  What?!?!?!  Not our fault they were as slow as molasses. Needless to say we won't be back. We'll stick with our go to place.

This place is awesome!  They're very friendly and polite, they recognized us the second time we went (and every time since). The All-You-Can-Eat is a great deal, it even throws in some extras like saki shooters. The half-orders on rolls is a great option. There's non-fishy options for those dragged along for the sushi experience. They even offer a frequent-eater punch card! (Buy 10, get 1 free?)   The ONLY bad thing about this place? It's hard to find! The map shows it completely wrong! It's the SE corner of Centennial and Simmons.

I'm back with a super disappointed review.  I've been in now 3 times with no tables.  There is literally no room to wait and They have been kinda rude about the wait so I've left all 3 times.  Tonight they had 3 tables open but I was told they were reserved.  Are you serious?  Haven't eaten here in months and we used to come pretty regularly.  Guess I'm looking for a new Japanese restaurant.  Not cool sushi tachi.

This is by far one of the best finds in NLV! Fish is fresh!!! I am very picky I have done sushi wow and sushi loco a lot of places around Vegas! My husband and I have been coming here since it openned. Staff changes but Haro has been here quite a while and is worth getting to know! This is a must for true sushi lovers!!

I've been to this restaurant a few times now and it has been great each time.   They have an All You Can Eat (AYCE) menu available for lunch and dinner that is pretty great for the price.  The quality of the Nigiri is very good, with the fish large enough to cover both ends of the rice, which is something you don't expect with AYCE.  The menu also has a very large and elaborate selection of hand and specialty rolls.  The AYCE menu also has things like miso soup, chicken teriyaki, tempura, desert, etc...  all for $20 per person for lunch and ~$26 for dinner.  As others have mentioned there is a time limit listed for the AYCE menu, we actually asked the owner about this the first time we visited and he said it's just there to prevent abuse. I'd recommend the AYCE menu for groups who like sushi and want to try all the different nigiri and specialty rolls.  As others have mentioned they have some great lunch specials.  This place is definitely worth a visit if you want some quality sushi for a price that won't break the bank.

So far this is my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Service and the quality of food is awesome.   Everytime I come I get the AYCE/AYCD (Sun-Thur) deal ! Start off with there baked mussels and scallops then off with the rolls. I'm a big fan of baked rolls and their baked rolls are tasty !  Don't forget to try the specials on the board behind the sushi bar !

I use to go here a lot, having lived in the area before, it was a favorite. Today it just happened to be halfway between a friend and I, perfect for a lunch date but we were both disappointed. Service was rude- 2 girls took turns both taking care of us and more often then not when we asked for something we were told to "hold a minute" & when they came back they'd forget about what we did ask.  Quality of sushi was not up to par either, unequal in size and sloppy-did not hold its shape. Hopefully just a bad day and not always like this, I use to really enjoy this place

Really good sushi, great service and nice atmosphere. First time in here and we'll go back. We've lived all over the country and really enjoy finding a good sushi restaurant. This is our new place in North Las Vegas!

expected a good date night atmosphere, but I was wrong. It was a bit cafeteria atmosphere. Ordered sushi the most expensive one and oh no, it was bad. Not fresh, just old maguros on top must be frozen several times.   This place might be the place for only Americanized Californian rolls, but not for the sushi-sushi. Drink served in cheap plastic cups and food and dirts on the floor, plain cafeteria look.   I don't recommend this place if someone picks here for date night

No way these guys get 4 stars.  Somebody needs to tell these people that they're not on the strip. LOWER UR PRICES!!!!! You're sushi isn't that good and service was ehhhh at best. You're better off going to smiths and getting their pre-made sushi.  They need to close this place down and scrub the grease smell out of it and do some dusting also.
Absolutely love this place, it's our date night spot!!!

Awful! Why does this place have more than 2 stars?? Is it because of the beer specials? It's certainly not for the food or service!! This place offers AYCE at strip prices but not at strip quality. I came with friends on a Friday night, my second visit only because a friend likes their half orders. I was leary because of the slooooooooow service before but decided it could deserve another chance. BAD IDEA!!!  It was very busy and the wait was long. Once seated the waiter was attentive and suggested we place an order straight away, after looking at the full restaurant we decided it was a good suggestion. We should have researched and placed our entire order for the night because it took over an hour to get half an order in and received!! They had very few staff which makes no sense on a busy Friday night! Half our table was already eating dessert by the time the other half of the table had received their main sushi course! Our party had to leave and I had to leave with them even though I didn't get my order at all. AYCE here not worth another visit and the food quality is not worth the money.

Good food, good sushi and reasonable prices for AYCE. Dinnertime in the weekends can get pretty busy so sushi may take longer than usual. Sushi rolls can also get sloppy when they're busy. They have a large selection but beware of the 911 roll. We always get the salmon collar and their ice cream is excellent. Most of their food is average but we always get great service. 4/5

I've been going her for a few years now and it was good before but now their EXCELLENT!!! They have recently hired a new chef Harold (Haru)  he was fast and attentive.  He cut some gloriously thick slices for the Nigiri, Maguro, Salmon & Yellow tail! The food that comes out of the kitchen is all well prepared, and I recommend the tasty green mussels but I go for the sushi For an all-you-can-eat-in-under-an-hour kind of place, the fish is always fresh.  Chatting w/ Harold he asked me what I liked and how spicy I like my food & after 2 of the menu rolls he asked if he could make me something off the menu I told him cool do your thing. it was AMAZING!!!! He calls it a mother w/ child (salmon on the outside w/ salmon roe a delicately sliced lil piece of lemon) after that he was free to make me what he wanted and after that decision I have never had so many total melt-in-my-mouth moments. Considering the quality of Harold's work, the A.Y.C.E. hour is the way to go.   But be careful.  By the time I was ready to leave, I thought I was going to burst because i could not stop eating and when i finally did I remembered that rice expands in your stomach.......SO AGAIN BEWARE!!!  The only thing bad I can say about Sushi Tachi is don't go on Wed or Thurs (Harold's nights off)
Really good sushi and one of my favorites!!! This place gets busy because its that good. Just check out the reviews and try them out. Its a real gem!!! :)

I was a US Marine stationed in mainland Japan for 3 years. I swore if i ever went to a Japanese restaurant i'd either REALLY want it or it'd better be some of the best stuff ever.  This place...WOW  The size of the place is just perfect it's not too big but it's big enough to hold a good crowd, it's small enough to look crowded or semi crowded when it's not up to full capacity.   The pricing is very unique, you can either go by the cost of individual pieces or go for the 45min all u can eat set price for lunch or the 60min all u can eat set price for dinner. The price is okay considering that's how much a high end buffet costs anyway.  The thing that changed my opinion about this place is that the menu is very creative you can get standard stuff like every place has, i made the mistake of getting a California roll for a start before my buddy told me i can get anything i want because it's already paid for. HIGHLY recommend the Mahi Mahi...thingie...it's on the specialties part of the menu bottom left corner. The leaf they put on the roll makes biting into it so refreshing and the tartness of the sauce they drizzle over just ties everything together. Simply amazing  I give this place 5 stars because of the creativity of some of the things on the menu. There are things i didn't like and some faults i noticed  MAYONNAISE oh god i hate how the Japanese love squirting the stuff on everything. The baked muscle and scallop shell are just covered and baked in mayonnaise, completely killed the sweet natural seafood flavors of the muscle and scallop.   In conclusion i will be returning to this restaurant when ever I'm in the rare mood for sushi

I always get the dinner special here! Service here is super friendly and helpful. Parking is free and its not hard to find. Havnt tried the all you can eat sushi yet but one of these nights i will. There hamachi kama is also super ono over here. Prices are pretty cheap too for what you get. I bring friends here and they all surprised at what we get and the quality of the food. If your looking for good quality japanese styled food this is a good stop if your up here on the north side of town.
My favorite sushi bar in vegas. Sushi chefs are great n very helpful. They also have tepanyaki tables.. great place
The sushi is really good but the past two times I have gone, the service was VERY slow. It should not take 30 minutes to take our order.

Brought the entire FAM bam for supper tonight and we all had the AYCE. Our two youngest ones were measured against a mark on the wall and got a lower price for being shorter... So sweet! Service was fast, there was no rushing us, we enjoyed every roll that was brought out. Definitely be coming back. I just wish they had better seating. 5 people in one booth was a bit crowded, the tablespace was limited too.   It was a good first time sushi experience for the kids. They all want to come back again already!
Was able to enjoy a great meal during my Birthday weekend! Very nice ambience, attentive wait staff, fresh fish!

Very nice place. The servers were all very nice. Good energy from everyone. We got the all you can eat lunch. The rules are the same as every where else as far as no left overs unless you would like to be charged no sharing unless the other person has AYCE as well. The time limit of 1 hour isn't the longest I've seen but it was enough for us. On to the food. There were rolls that were very delicious and then some that were not. I personally did not like their garlic ponzu sauce however their spicy mayo was the opposite. I overall enjoyed the visit and unlike a few places I have been I was happy to taste their fresh ingredients. Some places give you old shrimp tempura in the roll and it is obvious and decreases the taste value of the roll by a lot. Well 4 stars from me which is as good as you can get unless i loved every flavor and taste from my favorite rolls.

In the outskirts of North Las Vegas, there lies a gem. Not just any gem, but a gem lost in the neighborhoods of Aliante. A gem that has strayed from the inner city and traveled along to make it's own way into our hearts... err, stomachs that is! ;) I can speak for many sushi lovers out there that love and enjoy the comforts and different tastes that a lot of sushi bars and restaurants offer to their patrons.  A comfortable and home-like setting provides the city and part of Aliante a place to make their own and enjoy great eats without the rage and rush of middle aged adults. Sometimes, a quiet place is in order to enjoy great company and conversation. And upon reading that semi-theatre-esque introduction, Sushi Tachi is that hidden gem in Aliante.  The menu is pretty similar to the Sushimon chain, but what really makes this place stick out is their outstanding service and polite manners. 3 stars for the similar menus to Sushimon but location and service give Sishi Tachi a generous!  Baked green mussels and cajun albacore nigiri FTW! Happy eating :)

Great service, fresh fish, quaint spot that obviously have so many frequent returning local customers (hence the offered punch card). AYCE and all you can drink house beer and sake for 25? Get out of here!!! I also love the fact that you can do half rolls to try a little bit of everything. It's not just sushi but an extensive menu of hot items too which is something you don't see too often. My favorite is probably the Cristina roll.  Go here, love it. Best bang for your buck.

Sushi Tachi....was my favorite Sushi bar i would make the 30 min trip from spring valley up to 3 times a week. However Haru (the head sushi chef) no longer works here thus this place is just another sushi bar :/ i will no longer be driving there any more. i resign the crown of duchess to Tachi
Pretty good and close for AYCE Sushi.  AAYCD Bud Lights and sake too.

We love sushi tachi, waiters are very nice and attentive. Food is great quality and fresh. All you can eat included free beer and saki sun-thurs unlimited. I have been there dozens of times in the past few years and never had a bad experience.

What? I'm so confused why this place has a high rating. Decided to hit up this place in NLV cause I was chillin' with a fried.  We were starving. We wanted fish. We wanted some place close.  Had AYCE for lunch, it was about $26.  Nigiris are okay. Fresh but the rice ratio. Uh-uh, too much rice.  Rolls, you can order half. Make sure you eat your rolls right away cause if you leave it out, it gets gross.  I'd come back but I really don't see the point of driving all the way to North town.

I liked this place alot! The food and service was great! And I really like the ALL you can eat Sushi idea! The only thing is that its kinda expensive. Most dishes were more then $12 for 8 pieces. All the chefs were really cool though. I will definitely be going back.

Dined here after reading all of the rave reviews of this place.  Had pretty high expectations and wanted to love it.  Unfortunately, will never eat here again.   If I were the kind of person who'd consider panda express to have the best Chinese food or olive garden to have the best Italian food then I'd prolly consider this place to have the best sushi.  That's the only way I can describe it.  It's like the panda express of sushi.   We didn't get the AYCE cuz, well, we don't do AYCE sushi.  Tried to order some nigiri but they didn't have any really good types of fish.  Just the standards: tuna, salmon, yellowtail.  So ordered a couple of rolls with various fish selections.   Nothing was remarkable and the salmon was slimy.  the service was all but non-existent. we sat at the sushi bar and were ignored by all 4 sushi chefs which would be forgivable if the bar was full but there was only 1 other customer there. 4 chefs to 3 people. hm.  it seems as though they have quite a loyal following which is fantastic for them and i hope that those patrons continue to be just that, loyal.

Delicious sushi packed with flavor in a small restaurant.  The bar is huge and takes up tons of space but dining is still ample.   They serve AYCE and all you can drink beer and Sake but the alcohol is only Sunday- Thursday.   The Poke is delicious and very fresh.   The service was good but a bit slow as we had a party of 16. The servers were very patient and friendly.  Food came out and everyone was happy.   The location is a bit of a drive from the strip bit well worth the visit.   Fortunately my friends were staying at the Santa Fe so it wasn't even a ten minute drive.   Parking is easy to find so I'd probably return here again if back in Vegas.   Next time ill drop in on a Sunday to enjoy the beer and sake.   If you really want to enjoy this place, be sure to come with a small party.   That way you can order what you want and get it quickly as there is a time limit on the AYCE.

I love this small all you can eat Japanese restaurant, all the staff are friendly, their food are fresh. Chef is very nice, they don't put a huge rice underneath the sashimi, they don't monitor while you are eating.  This place is good for family also, they have big table for 6-10 ppl. Their sashimi is fresh cut everyday. Nothing left over from the previous day. Sunday to Wed also have all you can drink....... :)

Sushi Tachi is my go to sushi spot . All you can eat is 23-26. There are so many other items that you can order besides sushi in the all you can eat menu ( teriyaki chicken, egg rolls, Michu ice cram etc. sushi tachi is pretty small so the ambiance is always really comfy and chill. Prices are good and sushi is good too.
This is our go-to sushi spot.  We always do the all you can eat because we have so many favorites!  The Santa Roll and Tuna Roll are a couple of our favorites....  Staff is always awesome.

My wife and I came here with a few friends who had talked the place up.  I won't say that I'm a sushi connoisseur, but I've eaten my fair share.  To be honest, the fish didn't taste as fresh as it should.  I was underwhelmed by the quality, and the speed of service definitely left something to be desired.  We were seated at 5pm, decided on AYCE, and we weren't served our first roll until 530!  On top of that, we had to pester the waitress to even get our place settings.  Because we didn't get the wasabi, ginger, and soy sauce until after the first roll was brought out, we didn't actually start eating until 545.  Luckily, they were lax on their 60 minute time limit, otherwise, we may have only eaten two rolls between all four of us.  Unless the service and quality see a marked change, I most likely won't be frequenting this place.

I ventured all the way up here from Henderson to meet a friend for dinner. The restaurant is on the small side (but about average for a sushi place) and doesn't have the best decor. The booths are ripped and worn and there isn't really any unifying decor theme to speak of.   They offer both a la carte and AYCE options (AYCE is $27 per person for 60 minutes). We ate glutton-style. The menu is huge and the waitstaff definitely doesn't give you enough time to look over the whole thing before they're standing over you, ready for your order. You are able to order more than one item at a time, which is nice. The sushi bar is quick, while the kitchen is a bit on the slow side.   The sushi was fine. The fish was good-quality, but none of the rolls I sampled really wowed me. They are a bit rice-heavy and every single roll has sauce, which can be dangerous. None of the flavors really melded or set each other off in a delicious way. This restaurant seems to be an excellent example of doing a lot not that well, rather than doing a little bit extremely well. I think if they pared the menu down by half (seriously, it's that huge) and created a handful of well thought-out, complementary rolls, the experience would be much more enjoyable.  Food to dollars ratio: unimpressive, might be worth it if you're in the neighborhood.

I always get the Dragon roll and I think the name of the other roll I get is called the moon roll. The fact that they have half orders available on the menu really tickles my fancy. It's very affordable and the quality is good for the price.  I would say the only downsides are that I'm too short whenever I sit at the sushi bar, and the servers make me feel like I'm being smothered. Never fails.

Where do i begin....We decided to drive out of our way to check out this spot based on the reviews and the AYCE with AYCD (all you can drink) included. So it turns out the address on yelp is incorrect because it took us at least 6 miles out of the way. We get there just to find out that they only do the AYCE with AYCD on certain days. I understand that i shouldn't rely completely on internet information to determine menu and address, but doesn't the business itself heavily rely on the information online to generate business?? We got there disappointed and explained our situation and that the information on yelp was incorrect. They showed no sympathy at all to make an exception and honor the deal. It is also sad that I, the customer, has to inform the people that the address is incorrect. If you decide for whatever dumb reason to go to this retched place, the correct address is 2805 W Centennial Pkwy

I did the AYCE and they have a wide selection of sushi rolls to choose from.  The good thing about this place is you can order half rolls so you don't fill up too fast on just one.  Went on a Friday night around 7, wasn't too packed, they also have bar seating.
sushi wasn't too bad, specially for an ayca sushi. But the lady had the audacity to demand  tips after not only they ignored our table but the big dude gave us attitude.
Very nice sushi, good service and good value at price. Really happy to have a quality sushi joint nearby to where I live.

There's no place in Aliante like Sushi Tachi, and no host quite like Jimmy, who treats everyone as a long lost, most treasured uncle! We eat take-out several times a week, and have also dined-in. The food is consistently superb, and even vegetarians will find the menu accomodates them nicely. Greatly appreciated: Sushi Tachi gives you the choice of soy paper wrappers instead of seaweed for sushi. Fast, attentive service at a very reasonable price, while retaining reputation for excellent cuisine. I couldn't make it a week without eating at Sushi Tachi--even though there are several other sushi restaurants in the area. This is the BEST, and the best value for the $$.

I have been here multiple times - I have filled up 3 of those all you can eat cards. The food is pretty good, sushi is pretty good. bathroom could use a good scrub down. the whole menu is part of the all you can eat. Including beer / sake on the right nights.

What an experience! Dined here while visiting friends in the area. It was decided before we arrived we'd be having the $26 pp all you can eat option. I was a little skeptical that all the items we'd try would've tasty or that the portion size for an all you can eat option would be very big. I was wrong on both accounts though! Very tasty sushi, miso soup, cucumber salad & beer!! Couldn't believe the number if items available on the all you can eat menu nor the number of items we constantly had rotating from the sushi bar to our table. This place would be a very dangerous option for this sushi loving couple if we lived it the area. Would love to come back again the next time we're in town.

Once again, Tachi is so convenient! I enjoy the sushi. Keep in mind it is AYCE, not Yellowtail at the Bellagio. Price is fair and the all you can drink Bud Lights are a blessing in disguise.   I recommend the Christina Roll, the ahi poki, and Cajun albacore.   Stop by and ask for Yuka!

I love Sushi Tachi! The Tachi #2 has been a long time guilty pleasure of mine, basically for the avocado, cream cheese, and deep fried elements. I tried the sashimi combo for 2 and it was the best meal value I've ever had! $25 to stuff two people with yummy fish, shrimp/vegetable tempura, chicken, rice, miso soup, and ice cream to finish it all off... it doesn't get better than that!

I just left this restaurant and I'm a big fan. I tried a 1/2 roll that had shrimp tempura, avocado, and cream cheese on the inside and then crunch and eel sauce on the outside. It was really good and perfect for me since I'm pregnant and can't/won't eat real sushi. I then ordered the dinner special which is like a bento box. This is my review of the items in that dinner special:  miso soup - pretty good but a little saltier than I'm used to salad w/ house dressing - it was ok  teriyaki chicken - I did not like this white rice - average shrimp/vegetable tempura - pretty good california roll - delicious and it comes with 8 huge pieces  My husband and I also ordered the tempura fried chocolate ice cream which was delicious. I also have to rave about the price. My dinner special was only $10 and my 1/2 roll was around $4. These are great prices and I was beyond stuffed when we left!! I'll definitely go back!

Sushi can be hit or miss... This place was a grand slam! The all you can eat menu is extensive, and the service is great. I have never had sushi prepared as quickly as they do it at Sushi Tachi... And so tasty too! I was very pleased to have found this place.

Went to Sushi Tachi with a friend for dinner. He had the all-you-can-eat, which came with free bud light or saki and I ordered ala carte. The sushi was good but not the best I have ever had. I was satisfied with my meal and my friend liked everything he ordered. They said there was a 60 minute limit on the all-you-can-eat but we were their about 90 minutes and he kept eating. I would go back as it was close to my friends house. Restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly... Could have been a little faster bringing our sushi but overall had a good experience.

Sushi tachi in short words is just amazing, this place has all you can eat with fresh ingredients and the best by far customer service! So friendly and catering that perhaps they just became my favorite sushi joint in town, try the uni(sea urchin) nigiri sushi and just wait to be delighted by the delicious flavors!
My favorite sushi roll is the NY girl in Vegas. Order it now, thank me later. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the staff isn't always the greatest.

All you can eat sushi... I used to picture week old fish and slimy seaweed, until I found this place.  Sushi Tachi has great sushi, good service, and all you can eat of it.   I don't know of any other place where you can get all the sushi your heart desires for ~$20 (outside of eclectic buffets) and still have it taste good.  Come hungry and get the all you can eat sushi, then go for half portions so you can sample their delicious menu.

I have to say that this place is pretty awesome for all you can eat sushi. The sushi isn't the best that I have had in town, but its pretty good.  I went with three friends from work, and we all ordered the AYCE lunch at $24.95 (dinner is $26.95, with only a few items available only at dinner).    The sushi itself was pretty good, despite the non-Asians behind the bar.  Its just sushi after all.  The fish seemed fresh, although the octopus was a little rubbery compared to a couple of other spots I've been to.  The rolls were rushed through and falling apart a little, but that wasn't a big deal at all.  A few of the specialty rolls were really good, including the Valentines roll.  Since we all bought the lunch special, we could all share, and good times were had.  The ginger was particularly good here too.  It was light yellow in color, and sweeter with a less pickled flavor.  I am not a big fan of ginger in general, but this ginger was really tasty.  The one thing that was offsetting was the abundance of signs explaining the rules of the all you can eat... rules like eating all of the rice or paying full price.  I didn't feel like the place was very hospitable when we sat down at first.  Even my friend said jokingly, "Feels like a dictatorship in here."  That feeling changed though because the service was really nice.        Overall, while I would say there is better sushi in Vegas, the AYCE aspect scores this spot an easy 4 stars.  I would love to go back when I am in the mood for a quick, yet thorough stuffing of sushi!
Place is bomb dot com fresh fish and saki was good , great service my friends loved it at killed it so manny rolls and poki ahi

I recently discovered this place by accident. After eating here the first time and finding out that they have all you can drink included with their ayce menu, I was hooked. The food is good. The service has always been great. Everyone is very friendly. They have a good variety of things on their ayce menu. A variety of appetizers and kitchen items on the menu is what I look for with ayce. I'd recommend this place to anyone who's wanting to try it.

I came here for the first time with my friends we did all you can eat sushi and it included all you can drink beer and sake. This is the first place I go that has that, it was pretty exciting! The rolls overall are great. I would definitely go back for the sushi.

The wife and I went here for lunch one day. We wanted to try a new sushi place and this place had good reviews. It was not crowded but it was a Monday afternoon. The service was good for a lunch meal. The menu is pretty big and I love hat they include pics as well. The big issue I have is that the rolls don't look anything like the pictures. It's really not that big of a deal but it was a little issue. Other than that the food was OK. Nothing spectacular but just a little better than average. With Kaizen being around the corner (my favorite spot) I don't know if I'll be back but I definitely recommend coming here.

It has the prices of the AYCE places closer to the strip but the quality just isn't there. The freshness was just a little less than I'd hope for on some of the Nigiri pieces. The rolls were good and their sauces are tasty. The service was quick and polite.
