This place was awful. I'd give it zero stars if I could. I came here Saturday night with my boyfriend for date night. First off the restaurant itself just seemed dirty and outdated. I was craving sushi so I got the ayce and really wish I hadn't. The sushi wasn't fresh at all. The pieces were fairly small and tasteless. The rolls were really rice heavy with barely any fish in them. My boyfriend got a chicken teriyaki bowl and it was awful. He didn't even eat half of it. The service was not so great either. My cup sat empty for most my meal as the waitress just walked back and forth. On top of that they brought me out an extra plate stacked on top of dirty ones. So not impressed with this place.

This is the best sushi in Vegas. The prices are very reasonable and the food is outstanding. Their all you can eat menu is huge and offers a large variety of sushi and kitchen items. They offer ramen, bento boxes, iron, soba, teriyaki and tons of rolls. They use cream cheese a lot in their rolls which offers a ton of flavor! I would highly recommend sushi tachi!

This is my mom's favorite AYCE sushi bar (probably because it's really close to her house), but I've never been disappointed after eating here.   The AYCE menu has plenty of options and you can order things not on the menus for the chefs (like yellowtail belly) & if they have it on hand, they'll give it to you too. The AYCE dinner price also includes hot sake and budlignt on certain nights which is an awesome deal!   The service is always good and the sushi fresh (although I received some questionable uni once, but they took it back without issue). They provide AYCE stamp cards so you can work your way up to a free meal which is always nice too.

We lived in Japan for almost 5 years and know good sushi versus bad sushi.  We had tried several local sushi places without finding The One.  A friend of ours told us to try Sushi Tachi and we've been going ever since.  We do the all you can eat and start off by ordering tuna, salmon, and yellow tail nigiri to see which fish is the best that day.  Typically two of the three are fresh and mouth watering.  We then continue ordering those and a few rolls which vary depending on our mood.  We always order the veggie tempura (which are amazing), gyoza, and calamari from the kitchen.  Put those orders in right away because they sometimes take awhile especially if they are busy.   If you are looking for authentic sushi, this is the place to go!  It's our go to sushi restaurant.

Before going we read mixed reviews, some raved about how it is the best sushi in Vegas, others said it isnt as good as it used to be.  We decided to order al la carte instead of all you can eat. IF we ever go again I will definitely be getting all you can eat, we ended up spending just as much, if not more on al la carte. For the quality of sushi and the price we paid, not worth it. The cruch roll tasted like it was sitting in the fridge for days. I expexted so much more based off the reviews. The environment, quality and service was not worth the $120 bill for four people. However I will say the servers were nice.

I really enjoy going here when I'm in the mood for a nice balanced assortment of all you can eat sushi but feel like I want to be wholly ignored by a seemingly nice but frazzled wait staff. The trick is to order everything you want from the all you can eat menu as soon as you sit down. Heck, write a list down on your paper doily and just hand it to them. Make sure you order everything you want, as they're not likely to approach you again until it's time to pay.
I was looking for a good sushi place in NW area. AYCE is great, good selection of Nigiri, friendly servers, good atmosphere.
Very poor service give you 60 minutes for all you can eat. Your luck if you get 2 orders in 60 minutes portions are very small.

No matter how many times I try new sushi places based on others' recommnedations, I always come back to Sushi Tachi.  Nothing really compares to Sushi Tachi in quality, presentation, and value.  As a sushi lover for 25 years, in addition to freshness and cleanliness, I look for simplicity.  Many sushi restaurants now mask their sushi (especially rolls) by using too much sauce on top or bottom of the rolls.    If you want simple, good nigiri sushi, this is still the best sushi place in the north/northwest part of Las Vegas.  All you can eat deal, which includes pretty much everything they make in the restaurant, is hard to beat.

It's Friday night, and I was craving some sushi but I didn't feel like driving all the way to Yama for some nommy sushi.  I then decided that I was going to try something new since it's been awhile I tried a new sushi joint. I did some research on here nearest to the house and this place came up first. (for all you stalkers, yes I live in North Las Vegas).  Gives you an idea how much I love YAMA.. 20 miles away and been there over 30 times!!! I think I got Duchess status on there =P Anywho, back to my point..   So this place is located on the corner of Centennial parkway and Simmons, right across from Fresh and Easy, Southeast corner of simmons where the Starbucks is at.  The AYCE sushi is $26.95pp. Which I thought a bit pricey for something I am trying new. I was thinking of going down the street to Sage Sushi for couple bucks less, but i went here for the adventure with my daughter. So we get there at about 1010pm. The YELP ad says, they close at 1130 so I thought, "Cool, we got time".. Soon as we sat down, server asked us for our drinks and the sushi bar chef asked for my order. 19 minutes later, tells me that I have 1 more minute to order,mind you I only have ordered the following: Spicy Tuna roll, and rainbow roll, edamame. I asked why he's giving me "last call" he said that he has to close his section by 1030. I told him I just got there! So he told me order more, so I just picked random ones I dont normally order, a lasagna roll, cream cheese based baked roll with scallops and ahi poke.. tuna salad..   How was it? None of the fishes (tuna) used in my rolls smelled or tasted fresh.. It was "fishy" and fish isn't supposed to smell and taste "fishy" if it's FRESH.. so yeah, it was gross... I had to wash down my food with red bean ice cream and diet coke!!! And i never drink soda at an AYCE joint, I usually drink water with lemon.. but that was too harsh, the lemon brought out the staleness of the fish even more when I went ahead and chased my stale sushi fish with water..YUK  Verdict.. $62 later, plus 20% tip (because i just do 20% as rule of thumb) I was out of there by merely 11pm.. total of 45mins, $75 less in my pocket, and not very happy... since It  had left a funny taste in my mouth.. LITERALLY! I Aint never gonna come back!! psshhhhh!!  This is what I get for cheating on YAMA.. (I love you YAMA)

Went here on Tuesday night with my boyfriend and roommate and had AYCE. The restaurant looked clean and for a sushi joint it had really bright lighting. They have all you can drink Bud Light and House Sake Sunday through Wednesday which is nice. The rolls were pretty basic nothing really stood out, the sauces on the rolls were placed on the rolls kind of on the sloppy side. My Philadelphia Roll came with cucumber instead of avocado like they usually do. But the fish is extremely fresh!  Our waitress was nice but unfortunately never refilled my water. Everytime she would drop an order off at our table she would run off so fast that it was extremely difficult to continue ordering or ask for refills. Although it says that they have frequent buyer cards we were not offered one. I gave them 3 stars because their ingredients are good quality and maybe we came in on an off night. I would consider going back but I'm definitely going to scope out other sushi joints in the area.
Decent desert sushi and passable service, but Yelp has the map wrong related to the address.  Eat the sushi, don't bother trying to "check-in," and be sure to ask for Mochi.

I really like Sushi Tachi for a few different reasons, but I don't think it's the best sushi I've ever had. They have a really good selection of rolls, and all you can eat as well. I've never ventured into the ayce realm so I can't speak about that.  The special roll listed at the bar is always good and interesting. My favorite part is that this place let's you order half rolls, which is awesome for me. I get a bigger variety with less waste! The miso soup is nothing special, vegetable tempura is good. I love their steamed shrimp shumai. Delicious.  The service here is hit or miss. Some of the servers seem confused most of the time. I've had many items forgotten and wrong items brought. It's never a catastrophe, but hopefully they'll step up their game!

What happened Sushi Tachi? Used to be good but after last night's visit, I don't even know if we're going back to your place! The nigiri sushi are packed with lots of rice! Felt cheated on the AYCE! It seems like there was some slime on the mackerel and the salmon skin hand roll is mushy inside. Sorry Yuka we are gonna miss you! Very Sad:(

I will never come back to this place. Went there for lunch, i paid for lunch price and my husband the dinner price. Waitress will not let me order my husbands choices that was only available for dinner price. Why does iit matter? Theres a limit 1on their special sushi anyway. Even the dessert i wanted mochi and she said it was only available for the dinner price. And her point was? So my husband had to actually order it since he paid for the dinner price.nbad bad service

I've been to this place over a dozen times, great service and excellent fresh sushi, they have football jerseys hanging on the walls and always have some kind of sport playing on the tube, their ahi poke bowl is delicious! from handrolls to uni they have sushi that's first timer friendly.
This place is fantastic.  The food is a delicacy.  The presentation is simplistic for Japanese food but the flavor of the food with each bite is an explosion of culture and desire.

This place is the best all you can eat sushi on the north side! I only like Haru sushi chef because he is the only one that knows how to make sushi... I ordered a poke salad from one of the other guys and it had literally 5 dinky pieces of sushi and a handful of seaweed! I ordered it from Haruand my god it was the best poke salad I ever had... Haru is ironchef of sushi tachi!

Stopped by this place while on a business trip. Ordered one of their combination box lunches. The food was just average. Nothing outstanding nor bad at the same time. Portion size was just right. The chicken teriyaki wasn't dry but the flavor was somewhat bland. The miso soup was somewhat bland as well.  One thing that I was taken aback on was the rips and tears in the seat cushion at the booth I was seated in. It didn't help with the presentation of the restaurant. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant due to the worn furniture made this restaurant a borderline causal/divey place to me. This is not a place I would take a date to. Pricing for their entrees were reasonable. So if you are hungry and you don't care about the looks of a restaurant, this place would be suitable for a quick lunch.   Service was fine and they were able to serve the combination box to me in a timely manner. So the wait time to serve you food was quick. If you are short on time, you may want to try this place.    Parking at this restaurant is very easy. It is in a strip mall with ample parking. If I were short on time, and just wanted to eat something that was average, then you should give this place a try. But if you want to impress a date, you should look elsewhere.

Great place for sushi. I have recommended it to everyone of my friends. Who all have enjoyed going there. They have a great staff as well as great chefs. They are extemely friendly, and have great speed of service. The sushi is awesome, my favorite is the garlic tuna. I'm an addict, and would eat it everyday if I could.

Wife and I love sushi. Been to quite a few in vegas. This is our favorite so far, place is well lit and the food is great. Their live atmosphere is nice, open lay out, not too dim. Behind the sushi chefs there's a TV, usually playing sports not loud, so it's easy to have conversation without the tv drowning out ur conversation.  Down to the food, food is great all the rolls I've tried are good. Tiger roll is bomb. My fav. Tried the lisa lisa, and black jack plus like 10 others at the different times. AYCE is great plus ALL u can drink which is definitely a bonus. Overall this is fun laid back and I would highly recommend to anyone who likes sushi.
Service is awesome. The sushi is just OK. For AYCE, this place is on the high side of the price range. They really skimp on the portion size of the fish in the nigiri.

Yummy sushi and one of the better ones in northwest Las Vegas. Definitely regulars here and go during off hours like Monday and Tuesday for lunch because you will definitely get all the attention from the sushi chef.
Bad sushi, bad service. Uneven, and unflavorful rolls. All you can eat does not mean all you can eat, beware you will walk away with extra charges.
Never again. Just go to Smiths and get your own sushi. It took 30 minutes to get 8 pieces of sushi.  Felt uncomfortable and felt like we were bothering them.  Very disappointed.

Had not been here for a while (about a month or so) and was anxious to get back and see Haru again.  Unfortunately, he was let go recently.  I loved Sushi Tachi in the past because Haru made everyone feel like you were a valued customer.  And while the wait staff is still very friendly, it is obvious that there is now something missing.  I am sure we will return, but with lowered expectations.  I certainly hope they hang on as we have enough empty strip mall properties in North Las Vegas...but I fear that what made this place EXCEPTIONAL is gone and we will now be looking to where Haru lands next.  In the mean time, I sugggest that they continue making Haru's exceptional roll creations...

Glad we decided to eat here. Was craving sushi AYCE. This place is kind of small, but luckily it wasn't that busy. Good service, tasty sushi. Didn't care for the special rolls, but wasn't a problem. Our waitress took it away and didn't seem to mind. Would definitely go there to eat again!
This was at one time a great ayce sushi place. Quality has gone away. Rolls are small and mainly overly wet rice. So sad.

I used to love coming here, I introduced a bunch of my friends to this place but lately it's not been the Sushi Tachi I remember loving so much.  The last time I came, the rolls were kinda loose  and sloppy looking. It's like they didn't care how the food looked. To me food is visual, especially sushi so in my mind, it didn't taste as great as it once did when they payed attention to details.   I still love all their little small plates that come with the AYCE menu; especially the poke salad, seaweed salad, gyoza, shumai, fried oysters, shrimp tempura.   I really hope that it was just a bad day the last time I was here and not the standard of what this place has come to these days. It'll take me a while to make it back there to find out.

I love the quality of sushi here. They have a good selection, and the best baked rolls of anywhere I've been. The service is fast and just friendly enough. It is small in there, so the staff can easily keep an eye on you for when you need something, but they also seem to know when to leave you alone. Also, the restaurant is nice and clean.

This place was horrible. The sushi was not fresh and not tasty at all. They also put something really spicy in a roll that was not described as spicy. I left 90% of my food on the plate. I would honestly rather have thrown $39 out of my window. Oh, and I didn't get every thing I ordered but was still charged for it. Skip this place.

Always friendly. Fast and fresh.  I've been coming here since the first week it opened years ago. My kids grew up eating here too. Its like a family go to spot even if they don't each sushi itself.   Specialty rolls change every week.  Quite a variety to eat, even though they don't carry a couple of items some other places carry.  You are always guaranteed a good meal from the nice size cuts of fish served.  Tasty desserts too.

I've been coming here for a few years now since it's relatively close. My last experience was okay. The service was great, but the sushi was a bit underwhelming. In addition, it smelt like bleach when I walked in.
This our favorite sushi restaurant. Great lunch special and all you can eat sushi. The prices are very reasonable. Family friendly

This is our usual spot for sushi. And is usually great. This time however , I was a bit disappointed. Different sushi guys make it different. Lately the sushi presentation was messy, falling apart and I actually had the rainbow roll that tasted fishy!!! And the rolls were messy and totally fell apart. I love comin here and it's close to home. But I'm gonna give it a break for  a minute so they can get their shit together. They are great and nice people..

Came here for lunch when it wasn't too busy. Service was quick and they were very friendly. The sushi was fresh and tasted amazing. My favorite sushi place by far. The green mussels are on of my favorites and so far no other place has come close to the mussels they serve.

This is a great spot for those of us who live in North Las Vegas.  We normally go to a place on the other side of town, but decided to try something closer to home.  We came in and were sat in a comfortable booth.  The ambience isn't awesome.  It definitely doesn't give you a cool vibe, but is a standard restaurant feel.  We had the AYCE option on the dinner menu that is $26.95 per person.  The appetizers are all really good and come in super small portions so that you are able to order several.  All of the rolls that we tried were great.  I recommend the Volcano #2 roll and the Black Jack roll.  We also saw that you could order sake shooters.  BEWARE--these are actually a shot with sake, quail eggs and orange fish eggs.  I was not able to eat it.  I guess I should have asked what this was, but it doesn't specify on the  menu.  Overall a pretty good place.  You only have a 60 minute time limit at dinner with AYCE and I was worried the whole time about being rushed.  The waiters didn't seem to push us, but I did see that they noted our arrival time on our receipt.  I think it is a decent place to grab some sushi.

This place is awesome! I used to go to Yama Sushi on flamingo but this place is so much faster to seat you and friendlier staff! Plus you have to sit 10 inches from a person you don't know cause Yama sushi is small and crowded. Sushi tachi is my favorite place in Las Vegas.
Okay so I came.  I saw.  I Tachi'd and ummmmmm yah what are those four stars about?
I was introduced to this place by a friend of mine a few years ago, I absolutely recommended to anyone. The food is good and the staff  is nice and friendly.

This place is either going to be great or it's going to be quite an irritating experience depending what time you go. i have been there a few times in the duration of a few months usually on sat. around dinner. last night i went an hour and a half before last call it was great no one as pushing me to hurry up, service was great, and the food is adequate. I won't give up on this place it has so much potential i'll give it another go. Also if it's convenient i recommend sitting at the bar there is this sushi chef there who is simply just delightful to talk with if you are by yourself and he will take care of you, because of him this place gets 4 stars instead of 3
Kaizen is great! Rolls are tasty and staff is very attentive :) the creme brûlée and green tea ice cream were my favorite

Came back again to celebrate V-Day because we had such a good experience the first time we came. This time was a total disappointment. First off was the service they have signs all over putting a 60 minute time limit on the all you can eat. We waited 20 minutes just to order apperizers. Finally were served because the busser asked how we were. In all honesty she (the busser) had the best service in the place. Several things we ordered were forgotten and we had to ask where they were and were told they were still being cooked. (sure they were) As if the service wasn't a bad enough experience the sushi itself was nothing special.  I really wanted to tell management because this experience was not worth the $100 we are about to spend, but my husband does not like to cause any problems. We will just never be back. Please save yourself an expensive poor experience and go somewhere else.
If you want authentic Japanese food.. Def. Gotta come to this place. I'm from  Japan  and I enjoy their food :)

So the lady dropped of my tab and just by looking at it, I knew the items on my tab didn't add up to the total bill amount, by looking at the prices it was obvious that something didn't add up, so I pulled out my calculator, just to find out that I was over charged 8 bucks.... it was just me and my boyfriend therefore gratuity wouldn't be added to my bill nor was it noted on the bill that it was being added on, this was just someone not paying attention or rounding I'm not too sure but it's very frustrating to come across.
Food is always good. Never a long wait. Servers are easy to het a hold of.

If you're here to eat sushi with your friends and have a good time I wouldn't recommend you eat here because it's kinda dark and sad. I would recommend Tokyo Sushi for a fun up best place to eat with all you can eat. But over all the Service was decent at the beginning and slow at the end. Quick tip if you order something be sure to be exact on what you're ordering. Over all four stars.

Soo, my review for this shouldnt count toward whether or not you are debating to try the sushi. Why? I hate sushi! All I can tolerate eating is the su udon and cucumber salad. Soo yummy! Also the service is fantastic. Always greeted, seated right away and taken care of easily. One of the staff members reminds me of an asian patrick swayze. That has no significance to anything. Just thought id throw it out there!  Ps. The plum ice cream is delicious!

Love Tachi! The AYCE with all you can drink Sake and Bud Light is def the way to go! Service is always excellent and the fish is fresh and delish! Love the Blackjack, Christina and Rainbow roll! If you are daring enough, try the spicy tuna 911 roll! I usually only get a half roll! It is pure fire! To bad Chef Paul doesn't work there anymore tho. He was always my favorite. Not quite sure what's up with the football jerseys as decoration but that's whatever! Lol

Here you can get all the sushi you can eat for $24.99 and this includes your drink. They have a regular menu for people who are with those who love sushi but you might not. The sushi is actually pretty good. The service is excellent. Hey why not.

All you can drink sake with the AYCE? Yes, please.  So, I am a fan of another sushi place in town, but their appetizers aren't good.  Sushi Tachi has amazing appetizers, and decent rolls, but none stood out as spectacular.  The food was fresh, the service was good, but the rolls were very similar to the ones at various other places, and many were loaded with shrimp tempura or cream cheese or both--and I'm a fan of neither.  However, a solid buy for the money!
I wasn't impressed! It wasn't fresh and the bar is high, the chairs are short. I've had better sushi this was not good. They didn't have a variety of great sushi, I've had better.

Cozy fast service even though the place was busy . We were attended on is if we were the only ones there .  Waitstaff   always very courteous and know when to strike up a conversation , perfect date night . Best  rainbow rolls

I've tried food from this restaurant twice and I am just not impressed. The water tastes disgusting and I cannot figure out why because surrounding restaurants do not have this problem. Maybe they need a filter? Other than that I was not impressed with the sushi and would not eat it again. I also had a bento box that I would not get again. Everything lacked flavor and was more on the bland side.

Best place to get sushi! The staff is so friendly and prices are adorable. Rolls are fresh and not full of cream cheese filling or anything like at some places. The menu is large and prices are great. A must try if you're looking for sushi in NLV!

So I just went here tonight with a friend and it was ok.   When we first walked in the place seemed to have decor that belonged in a sports bar. It was busy so we put our names down on the list. Sadly there were two chairs to be considered the waiting area and there was already a group of people so we had to wait outside in order not to get in the way of the entrance. The hostess barely looked us in the eye. I understand being busy but she could've taken a minute to compose herself.  We were seated after 20 minutes and the service was fairly quick. They took our drink orders and check in after 10 minutes to see if we were ready to order. I got the salmon dinner. It had Salmon filet with teriyaki sauce, 8 pieces of California roll, vegetable tempura, shrimp tempura, salad, and rice. The portions were big but there are some critiques I could give. The salmon was a bit dry, the seaweed on the California roll made it more chewy than one would want and the salad barely had any dressing. But other than those critiques the service was good and the food wasn't bad.

Seriously?! 4 stars? This place is disgusting with terrible service. First of all, I'm on a time limit of 1 hour.... TOO BAD IT TOOK 45 min to get my first order.... Secondly, the food was disgusting! Skimpy rolls with nothing in them. My sushi was literally room temperature because it had been sitting on the counter for 25 minutes!!! I saw our server twice the entire meal, and both times, get this!!! BROUGHT US SOMEONE ELSE'S FOOD! I never saw half of the food that I ordered. I would have paid 62$ to take this whole experience back. Overall the worst experience for sushi I've ever had. I eat sushi 3-5 times a week and I doubt I will eat sushi again for a month. I'm completely disgusted. On my way out, excited to finally get my check, I noticed a HUGE chunk of hair covered in dust on the top of my booth... PUKE . Save yourselves from the worst experience of your life and avoid this place AT ALL COSTS!!!!! ( I wish yelp had negative stars ) PS yelp makes me give a star to post my review, like I said.... NEGATIVE
Love the Sexy Girl roll!! It's so addicting. The sushi is fresh and the service is great. It's starting to become my favorite sushi spot on the North side of town.
Great food, cute environment. I love the all you can eat menu & the dessert.  The price is decent and is a great sushi location in the north Las Vegas area. I highly recommend if you're in the area

So bomb! I ordered a-la-carte instead of AYCE because otherwise you can't take home leftovers! Lame. Anyway, dank sushi, sweet servers/chefs, cool vibes. Hella glad my friend showed me this spot! I wish I had known about it when I lived in vegas!!! Also, the menu items have hilarious names. Always a bonus. And the AYCE is also AYCD sake/beer!

I'm stoked that a sushi place is near my house, fairly priced, and has a few of my favorite rolls. I used to frequent Sushi Tachi more during 2013. Things have changed for sure. Flavor, service, etc. but it's decent for this side of town. If this isn't your first pick for sushi, I'm not mad at ya, I agree! But if you find yourself on the north side of town and want some quick rolls without a long wait, stop by! They have tv on sometimes, variety of rolls, some waiters are really nice.
This place is awesome! You can do AYCE & try allot of different roles! Came here in a group of 4 & tried 26 different half roles, nigiri & some tempura shrimp. So worth the food & the price!

North Las Vegas is sushi challenged to say the least.  We have a sprinkling of establishments but none to write home about.  Sushi Tachi is our go to spot because it's close to home.  It's friendly, clean and the food is good.  We truly enjoy it!

One of my managers recommended this place and ever since I've been coming back. It's pretty cool that on certain days not only it's ayce but it's aycd bud light and sake. Compared to the other ayce sushi places here in Vegas, this is the best one so far. My favorite is the volcano roll because it reminds me of my favorite sushi back in California that I would always get called, "lion king". It's not the same but it's close enough. They don't have any sort of roll like that here in Vegas and when I describe them what it is they just tell me to get a baked salmon roll but it's really not it. But anyways, they also have ramen here but I wouldn't really recommend it. I mean it's alright nothing special. I honestly feel like the only good thing here is just in their ayce sushi. However, you don't need to just get an ayce you can just do individual rolls. Oh and another thing I like about this place imo is that they have half rolls you can order so you don't get overwhelmed with getting a bigger/normal rolls. Service here is really friendly.. Or at least most of the time. I would have to say my favorite one is the girl with really short hair in sort of a pixie cut or boyish cut (sorry I didn't catch your name). I enjoy her the most just because she's really nice and I don't know I just get good vibes from her and I also like the way she talks lol. But one time I came there's this other girl who took our orders and I felt like she was being rude and so monotoned and just straight up giving me attitude as if she hated her job or something. Such bad vibes she was giving me to the point it kinda got me irritated lol. Well I'm going off on a tangent.. Anyways I would still come here regardless every time I'm in the mood for sushi or need to get my sushi fix on (which is probably once every week or two).
Great place to dine. Hugh rolls... Everything was so DAM...Great   The all u can  eat includes beer Sunday through Thursday... Really to awesome.
Dinner is much better than lunch fish is fresher.  Service was great on both good place.
Had to add an update. Been there a ton of times, even had my birthday party with 8 ppl and it was great. Food is consistently amazing :)
All you can eat, Yummm! The rolls were delicious and I love me some tempura ice cream. The service was a little slow but over all it was good. Definitely gonna make this my new go to sushi spot.

I can't say anything bad about this place. The service is excellent and they're all so friendly. You can see that they all help each other out. Location is in a nice neighborhood (just outside of Aliante). The restaurant is modern and clean. The food is fresh and delicious.

Our favorite place to eat in North Las Vegas.  They have great reasonably priced lunch specials and the all you can eat deal.  We go here to celebrate occasions whenever possible.  The sushi is always great and the staff is super friendly.  The service is excellent.  Their rolls are excellent and they give you a good portion on the Nigiri sushi.  If you do the all you can eat meal be sure to order some of the hot items from the kitchen - my favorites are tempura, shumai, calamari, fired oyster, edamame, and gyoza.  The lunch specials are filling an all under $10.  Update:  Service has gone downhill.  Fish is not as fresh as it once was.  I don't know what changed, but I don't recognize anyone working there any more.

Ok. Time to write an update. Finally broke the spell and went back there. Tried to shut off my brain about the hair in my sushi last time and think about all the good stuff they have. I must say I'm very happy I did so. Staff there always makes you feel welcome, and service is consistently very good. They have fresh nigiris and the all you can drink bud light and saki from Sun - We. I'm glad we decided to give this place another chance, they will see us more often in there now.  We were just so done with sushi WOW and how they sometimes treated us. Would rather spend my money somewhere where they appreciate us.

Absolutely fell in LOVE with this place!  It's directly behind a Gold's gym and one day after working out I decided to finally GO IN here! It's all you can eat daily AND Drink beer/sake (Sun-Wed). WINNER WINNER WINNER!!!!  They have a very nice and large menu, delicious selections, and a staff that is very friendly! I enjoyed my visit and plan to return on a weekly basis.   Note: the lunch buffet is limited to 45 mins and dinner to 60 mins, you must eat/drink all your food/beverages or risk being charged full price (per their signage and menu notations). BUT they do make half-rolls (4 pcs)!!!! Works out great for me!!!!!   I highly recommend to anyone looking for a good selection, good service at a reasonable price (was about 29.00 pp incl. tax; tip additional)

Been coming here for a few years, as it is close to Aliante! I can't speak for the AYCE sushi since we always have the dinner combo.  Personally, I like the salmon special and hubby always get their dinner special.  Glad to see that they have also expanded their menu to include curry and ramen.  Have to say that the food is definitely more 3 stars range but considering the price and quantity of food, I give it a solid 4 stars :)
Yep... sushi is damn good here! Waitresses are on point and make sure youre well fed if you do All You Can Eat!

STILL the bomb. Loved it on 2014 and still do. Order the special! Every visit! I'm serious! How long do these reviews have to be? Okay, so, great service, great sushi, AYCE is a great deal. Need I say more?

I'm not sure exactly but this place has disappointed me. My last actual Ayce visit before yesterday has been A while and things have changed alright. The friendly staff were still there and they had different chefs but i felt like they were going slow on purpose. I ordered side dishes and two of them were forgotten and the other arrived 20 minutes later. I used to love this place but it was just blahh. The quality of the fish is still one of the freshest i just dont feel its the same experience anymore and im saddened. Maybe it was just a slow lazy dayyyy.

Super Good.   Sushi Chef were super nice.   If you want something super spicy! get the 9-1-1 Roll!!! like OMG HOT HOT HOT HOT!  It says you can only eat for 60 minutes for all you can eat dinner, but we stayed there for like 2 hours and they didnt say anything. I think it just depends on how busy they are.  DONT FOLLOW  the map directions! it takes you to the wrong place. But the Address is Correct!

This restaurant is in an unexpected area of North Las Vegas. Best AYCE sushi for $26.95 (dinner) "in North Las Vegas" we've ever had. Their tuna, salmon, and yellow tail were all very fresh. We tried the 911 spicy tuna roll and it literally made us cry. Keep in mind, we're no whimps when it comes to spice. FYI, free all you can drink beer and sake on Mondays and Tuesdays with an AYCE purchase.  Make sure the waitress gets the order right, or else they bring you more food than you can eat ... which they will charge you for (they have a sign for that).
I have been dining at Sushi Tachi for many years now and still believe it is one of the best all you can eat sushi restaurants in town.

I've been more adventurous with my diet lately. Trying new foods and places to eat. Boyfriend and I made a deal to try at least two new places a month. So far, everything has been working out amazingly. Including Sushi Tachi.   Walking up, the word "sushi " in the sign looks worn out and I was worried that they were out of business. That wasn't the case.  We walked in and we're immediately greeted pleasantly. The girl had us seated quickly, it was quiet and slow with baseball on the TV behind the bar. She took our drinks and we signed up for AYCE. While waiting for our food, glancing around, the decorations are nice, it's pretty casual, seats aren't uncomfortable, and it's got a nice set up. Cosy but not cramped.   Boyfriend has devoured so much food. Nothing was bad. Although, I should have been more careful with my dairy intake. =P silly me.   The other waitress girl was super pleasant and very chatty with us. Boyfriend likes to chat, so that was a plus.   They weren't too pressuring about a time limit, possibly because it wasn't busy.
Cheap but not great food. I like the all you can drink beer though. The waitress was a weirdo.

I Love Love This place. I have been coming here for almost 10 years. I love the family oriented environment. The attention to detail..and the servers are amazing and super friendly. I would recommend this place to everyone I know

Still love coming here after all these years. Service and food are still great. I, for the life of me still don't get why people are complaining about the amount of rice (Bam S.). Seriously dude, if you wanted less rice and  sashimi, then eat at a place that specializes in sashimi. Octavio S. is pretty funny too. If you're going to bash a sushi restaurant over their dessert menu, then take your a** over to Baskin-Robbins. You act like you're paying a lot for an all-you-can-eat joint, bud. I wonder if you know you'd be paying more if you ate a la carte at any other restaurant. You're lucky they serve dessert at all. Green tea ice cream is enough for me considering the amount of sushi I'm eating.   In any case, this place is still one of my go-to sushi spots and I'm glad every time I come in that the staff always remains so friendly. Keep up the good work and don't let these fake food critics on yelp get to you.

Horrible customer service! Me and my best friend decided to give this place a try since our usual sushi place had a 30 minute wait time. Big mistake next time I will wait the 30 minutes.  First the host/waiter had horrible customer service. He was not friendly at all. We still decided to stay and put our first order in off the all you can eat menu. We ordered 6 things. The first 3 arrived and we started to eat. We ordered a roll called the chubby boy. It was not supposed to be spicy or have spicy tuna in it, but it did. When we asked the waiter about it he was unsure so called 2 other gentlemen to the table to stand and stare at it. After about 5 minutes they came to the conclusion that it wasn't spicy tuna and said it was crab meat mixed in yum yum sauce (still doesn't explain the spice and that roll wasn't supposed to have crab meat either)  Next our original waiter pretty much abandoned us so now we had a new waiter. He asked us if we wanted to order more and we told him we were still waiting for our other 3 items, but also ordered 2 more rolls. He said okay left and was back with the 2 new rolls. At this point we had already waited 40 minutes. We again asked him where our other items were and this time he asked us what the items were. We told him and he says "Oh we gave those to another table because I wasn't sure who they belonged to. Do you want me to put the order in again?" We told him no we just wanted the check. 15 minutes pass and no check. Then our original waiter comes back and ask if we wanted to order more. We told him no we just want our check then he says "do you want some ice cream" so we tell him no again.  This was the worst service I have ever had not to mention they did nothing to rectify their acknowledged mistakes. I understand things happen but at least try to correct them.

Great neighborhood sushi spot. Decor could use some work; the football jerseys don't really fit, and the tv is small. All-you-can-eat is worth it. (non-budlight/saki drinks aren't included though) Great selection of sushi rolls, product is fresh too. Chef's are friendly and make great rolls. Been here several times, service can be slow at tables when they are busy.
Wonderful service, great food and kind people. This is better then Kaya in Chinatown. Cleaner, cooler, no wait, polite. I really enjoyed and will be back for the all you can eat again.

Going straight to it:)  My lunch AYCE for 24.95;Dragon Roll(8). September's Spicy Mango Roll(7). Puffy Roll(7). Spider Roll(9). American Dream Roll(10). Lisa Lisa Roll(10). Sushi Monster Roll(6). Mt Fuji Roll(7). Tootsie Roll(8) Tako app(9). Shrimp Tempura app(9). Baked Mussel app(6).  Their Red Bean, Green Tea, and Plum ice cream are unlimited with AYCE, but Mochi is one per customer and only available for dinner price. I guess what made up for the fourth star was the all you can drink Bud and Sake(warm).  Real clean atmosphere with jerseys on the wall for decor. Staff is friendly and pretty consistent on checking up on you.

Sushi Tachi is our usual go-to sushi place in town, even though it is 30 minutes away from us. The food is good, the service is pretty good, and they have free Bud Lights and sake Sunday through Wednesday with AYCE. Sometimes it can feel like the staff is judging you for how much you eat/order, but just power through it and get down with your bad self!

Quick place to go to if you're craving for sushi. I got the tempura platter and it was really delish. It came with 5 tempura shrimp and several veggie tempura. I give them a five -star on their food. Place is decked with sport jerseys from famous athletes. What bothered me was the walls were filthy.  It looked like something was splattered on the walls and no one bothered to clean it or wiped it off.  And the booth chair was torn.  No matter how great the food is, if the place is trashed, it's not worth going to.

Came here around 7pm, there was a 30-45 min wait so we decided to go to the bar! this place was packed!! Was a lil annoyed w the wait time to place an order but giving that it was very busy I understood. As far as the sushi, they had a variety of rolls but not a lot in terms of cooked rolls ( or at least ones I was interested in). The rolls were decent, the staff was slow but nice. However, nothing wowed me  about this place to be completely honest..

Super yummy, good service.  AYCE had a nice extensive menu--well worth the price in my opinion.  And beer/saki is included for their AYCE menu Sun-Wed!  I used to live in this area and never realized how much I loved this place until it was farther for me to get to and I had to start trying other places.  Let's just say they don't compare :-) Will definitely be taking the time to drive out here and start hitting it up more often.

Forget the negative reviews you have seen.  This place is great!!  Great food, great service and their "all you can eat" menu is awesome.  No frills or fancy decor, just a great place to dine.  Was there on Valentines day and all the servers had smiles on their faces.
Super easy to order takeout and the food is always ready on time!!.. i ordered the flying Jason roll recently and it was sooo delicious.

The sushi was great! The cucumber salad, however, was not great. It tasted as it looked - like shredded cucumber, without any marination or vinaigrette. The servers were polite and attentive. However, when I asked that a roll be changed to a hand roll - I was told they could not do it, despite my willingness to pay extra for what I wanted. I was also unimpressed that they only offer frequent buyers club stamps to customers purchasing their all-you-can-eat option. I paid twice as much, and they wouldn't even offer one stamp. Four stars for food. Two stars for pleasing the customer. Sadly, that makes it a 3.

At a glance, the menu is creative & the all you can eat looks enticing. But we came in in a relatively large group & my fiancé did not receive her first roll until an hour after she ordered it. Most of our party also had large waits as well. The taste was fair to average, nothing to complain about, but there are better tasting sushi restaurants in the valley. A manager was extremely nice & tried to help out, but an auto-gratuity on the check was definitely in bad form after the very poor service.

This place is GREAT. Went in there on a Friday night at 5 and was seated right away. Glad we came in when we did because it got packed shortly after. The restaurant is fairly small. Seats maybe 50 people plus the sushi bar. But that wasnt an issue. The service was SPOT ON and the sushi was GREAT. Completely pleased with the service, staff, and food. Will be back again and again.

Damn I love Las Vegas and your all-you-can-eat sushi joints!  Why can't we do this in San Diego?  My cousin took me here during my recent visit to Vegas, and it was great.  They give you 60 minutes to order whatever you want on their AYCE sushi menu, which is almost everything.  They don't really time you though.  My cousin and I were there for over an hour and no one said a word  He even told me that he and his family were there once for over three hours and they kept on serving them.  Sunday-Thursday are also all-you-can-drink Bud Light and sake nights included in the $26.95 price.  The fish is very good quality and they don't skimp on the amount of fish in the nigiri or the rolls, which is awesome.  The sushi chefs and waiters are friendly although a little slow.  It's a good thing that they're not sticklers on the 60-minute time limit.  I'm definitely hitting this place up again during my next visit.  The more money I spend on sushi, the less I have to lose at the blackjack table.

First time I came here for dinner I loved it. Service was great, the rolls were fantastic. Fast forward one year later, visited again from Seattle for lunch and brought our friends. So disappointing. Horrible service from the moment we walked in. The rolls were not as memorable or unique as before, the execution of the rolls was not as beautiful or out of the ordinary. Was embarrassed we brought our friends to this place because the service was so bad... and we drove up from the strip. The shadiest part of our experience was the server adding her 18% gratuity on the post tax total. Will never go back.
Good sushi and great service. A bit pricey but will return because of the quality sushi and service

I'm an avid sushi eater and this place is a hole in the wall that you DO NOT want to spend your money on. Got the all you can eat for an hour. The waitress was an older Filipino lady who seemed really bothered to take our order. She came around twice and we never saw her again. We couldn't even utilize the all you can eat because no one was around and we weren't the only ones complaining that night.We said f-it and left. Went to complain and the guy that took our money couldn't speak English. There are way better sushi spots in Vegas. Don't waste your time here.

Can't beat the all you can eat all you can drink Sunday - Wednesday for only $25! Very clean and can get busy on the all you can drink nights. The service is good, but the food is what keeps me as a customer. We go there about 4 or more times a month. Definitely recommended it to friends!
Excellent service! The staff really stay on top of things. As soon as we arrive and are seated there is no hesitation to get to our drinks and order. The sushi  selection is always good! Mmmmmm.
This place is "okay" not bad!!   Dinning area: ugly  Hygiene: Poor  Service: Good  Food: Great   Platting: Awesome   And that's all I have to say about that:)!!!!

The service was really good but the sushi was god awful. The mackerel was barely edible (old). I ordered albacore (bincho maguro) and they soaked it in ponzu - nigiri. What? The salmon was fine. The hamachi was good. The eel tasted old. The snow crab (did you mean no crab?) was mostly Panko (Bread crumbs) and WAS NOT nigiri, it was a poorly wrapped Gunkan roll. It was just so off in execution I was really put off. The fish was not fresh. I did get a couple rolls and they were okay. They didn't overdo it on the rice ratio which is a common tactic but I just really was disappointed in general and frankly if I get sick I'm not going to be all that shocked.

If you've ever been to Umiya sushi this place doesn't compare. At first I thought maybe we just ordered a few bad rolls but as we kept ordering from the all you can eat menu it wasn't getting any better. Was really flavorless and I'm pretty sure that batch of albacore they had was bad. The price is about the same as Umiya on Flamingo but their stuff is worth the money if you don't mind the drive. As with any restaurant there will be good and bad staff. Our initial waitress was impatient but I think her shift was up anyway. Our second waitress was much better.

Found hair - white animal-type not human hair in my food and when I told the server/cashier he was like "oh sorry about that"...Really. I have NO PETS for that reason so I didn't bring it in with me. Gross! Only gave one star cuz I had to. Won't go back again.

Absolutely love this place ! Nice atmosphere small business ! Customer service was excellent , every employee was knowledgable ! The mussels && green tea ice cream are AMAZING . The pricing isn't bad at all ! Especially the all you can eat menu with sake && beer . Nd it doesn't hurt that I love sushi nd everything is fresh && tasty

My family and I have been here more than a handful of times. Whenever family and friends are in town, we bring them here too and they love it. We always opt to do AYCE, so I can't really say much about the a la carte menu, except that you, obviously, probably get more bang for your buck with AYCE. We like to get the usual favs, seaweed salad, miso soup, green mussels, and shrimp tempura (always hot, fresh, and crispy). They have a monthly special roll as well, which is nice if you're wanting to venture off the usual fare. If you're not sure about a particular roll, you can order half a roll to lessen any waste. Service is nice and friendly and is always ready to take orders. If it's a busy night and you have a large group, do expect to wait because this restaurant isn't that huge. If you become a fan of this place, they have a stamp card for every time you do AYCE. If you happen to come in for AYCE lunch, there are a few selections on the AYCE dinner menu that aren't available during lunchtime, but you can do the AYCE dinner menu for a few dollars more. Like to have beer or sake with your sushi? Well, Bud Light and sake are included with AYCE from Sunday through Wednesday. You're welcome.

I went to sushi tachi on monday for my birthday. I had never been there before. Well to my surprise not only did they have all you can eat but that same price also included all you can drink hot sake and bud light. The sushi was good and the service was great. The only downfall was that my bf couldn't find a sushi roll spicy enough. But since I don't care for spice ;) I'm giving them 5 stars!

I don't know why people hate on this place! This is the best sushi place ever. Service is fast and all the servers are nice and beautiful! My favorite roll there is the tuna lover's ! I highly recommend eat here!!

It's not the best sushi place, but for North Las Vegas, it's pretty good. You can't check in using your iphone yelp, because the address it maps is way off base. It's actually located on the corner of Centennial and Simmons/Aliante. If we didn't live in Aliante, we probably wouldn't make a special trip to come here. There was a sign that they will have all you can eat and drink (bud light and sake) starting in May, which is a big draw for my husband.  The menu has a good variety and I'm able to get udon for my daughter while my husband and I enjoy the all you can eat sushi. The hamachi collar and amaebi are really good. I loved the Salmon Skin hand roll too. The uni was gross, but that's what's expected from all you can eat places I guess. The service was fine and they seemed to keep a good pace even though it was pretty busy. We went about 6:30pm and it was packed, but at 7:30pm, it was dead.
Always love this place!

The worst service ever!! Only reason I still come here is because the sushi is so good. But the service pisses me off every time. They forget to bring out wasabi every time. Slow to check up on us. I'd give it a single star but the sushi is the only thing saving it.

This has become my standard sushi restaurant here in North Las Vegas. The people who run it are friendly, the service is solid, and the sushi is pretty good and reasonably priced.  They have nice lunch specials, and the All You Can Eat is a good time too for when you really feel like stuffing your face hard. :)  I wish they had a little more variety with their rolls, though. It feels like half the menu involved spicy tuna and there's only so much spicy tuna this girl can take.

This is far and away my favorite sushi place. After my favorite sushi Chef left a couple of years ago but they did not miss a step. My only regular restaurant in Las Vegas. The owner is amazing. The staff is on point. Love it all!

Great place, I saw it while passing by. Wonderful place to bring a date or to sit down for lunch at the bar. Large menu selection for that WI keep you coming back for more. We'll priced so you won't break the bank. They also have an all you can menu to choose from.

Unwound have not give this place any star.... I was hair here and about to get lunch, the door was open.   3 mins before the "actually" open the waitress ask me if I can wait outside the restaurant..... Are you kidding me!!!!!? I'll take my business somewhere else.
Love love love! My favorite sushi place up in North Vegas. Fast service and friendly staff. Nothing bad to say.

This is the sister restaurant of Sushi Mon, same owner, same great sushi, my all time favorite for all you can eat sushi, which was introduced to me by a japanese family. It is the real deal. Fresh sushi lots of protein, good service and if you are a  all-you-can-eat regular don't forget to ask for the stamp card for your free dinner. I am so happy they opened in North Las Vegas.

Very good service and quality sushi, only issue is that it is a little bit more expensive than other AYCE places ($25 for lunch).  Also, the location on the Yelp map is waaayyy off, use Google Maps if you want to find the correct location.

Very good sushi! Lots of options. I enjoyed it with my husband! The salad sauce is really good and my husband doesn't like salad that's much and he ate it! Service was a little slow we kept waiting for someone to come or pass by but none the less it was good and the waiters very friendly and helpful!

I have never seen lemon on top of the salmon, but it was refreshing and tasty. I usually order tiger roll at Japanese sushi restaurant I can't believe this is all you can eat quality sushi roll because it was delicious -!!;) I highly recommend.

Just not really impressed. Nothing really seemed fresh. Received a really poor cut of mackerel, mostly the skin. Edamame didn't come out very hot. Seaweed salad and cucumber salad were incredibly plain.   The server was very friendly and attentive, which is the only positive thing I have to say. Right down the street but won't be back.

We have been patrons of the Tachi for years now.  We use their frequent diner card and have gotten several all-you-can-eats for free.  Some rolls that are our favorites: New York Girl in Vegas Salmon Delight American Dream Tiger Moon River Spider  LOVE this place!!!  Highly recommend it!  Fresh every time.

The sushi here is GREAT!!!  I can't even recommend ONE roll because I've had SO many good ones. If you're a light eater, but you want to try 2 different rolls and pay for one.. they have half rolls for half the price!!  The sushi chefs are always very friendly, and I always have good service when I come here.  Their all you can eat menu seems like an awesome deal, unfortunately I haven't done it yet, but I am looking forward to trying it out one evening!!  Definitely TRY THIS PLACE!!

Came here with my dad and wife for all u can eat. Although the sushi is good, you wait FOREVER!! Ordered 4 different types of nigiri and it took multiple reminders and an 1 hr later to get just 2 of them. It wasnt until we spoke to a manager, that our order was completed.

Found this restaurant on yelp. Decided to do the All you can eat sushi bar for 26$ and some change. Sunday - Thursday it includes all you can drink budlight or house sake. Plus they take your order and make it for you fresh . The only catch is you have one hour to eat everything you ordered .. Anything left over they will charge you for. Since we went in a group of two females that was a bit intimidating and the only reason I didn't give five stars. I understand the desire to not waste food but without a actual timer you're on the edge of your table the whole meal. It seems to me they may be a bit relaxed about it.  Our service was Awesome.. Our server was helpful and friendly but everyone working was really nice . A server named David really stood out. He was engaging and friendly and very happy to help!! He even gave me the kiddie chopstick helpers since I'm fail.   For the money spent we got tons of food from Tempura, Gyoza to Sushi rolls and even delicious green tea ice cream at the end. It was a really good time !

I used to love this place. I think the quality has gone down a bit in the past few years. If you like okay sushi at a great price this is your place. If you want great sushi, maybe try somewhere else.

Food was good.  Sushi masters know how to prepare stuff on and off the menu.  I suggest sitting at the sushi bar so you can ask them to make you something special.. they usually do and it's good. I will be coming here again soon

The sushi here is great as I come here often. Everytime I get the AYCE. The service is always nice and friendly! I love their seared salmon. I would definitely recommend all sushi lovers to check this place out!!!

More of a 2.5 in my opinion. Just got home from this restaurant. Ate during lunch time.  The two waiters i had were very nice and helpful when i asked questions. It was my first time eating there. I decided to go with my brother since the place is near my house. We got AYCE sushi. The inside looked really nice and clean.  The lunch was $24.95 (45 mins) Dinner is $26.95 (60 mins)  I really didn't like their price for the lunch and their time limit. There are so many other places that have their AYCE lunch cheaper and with 60 mins, not 45 mins :P  The sushi was good though. Fish tasted fresh enough for my taste. Their baked sushi's tasted really good also. Since i'm a HUGE baked muscle fanatic, i tried their's and it was only "bleh, ok." I was realy disappointed at that.  My brother ordered his last roll and he had to wait for a long time because the chief's didn't make it for some reason. So he asked our waiter what happened and she went to go make sure that he got it as soon as possible. So we were glad at how nice and apologentic they were.   For dessert, they only offer the normal ice cream for lunch. Therefore, the mochi and tempura ice cream is only for dinner. I was disappointed about that as well :P  ~Overall: the place was "ok." Great service.  Good food, but definitely had better with a cheaper price. Horibble price for lunch, considering the time limit all the things that are not available.
Excellent sushi!  The chef, once figuring out our group's tastes, surprised us with one delicious roll after another.  My personal favorite was the rolls topped with thin lemon slices.
Definitely my favorite sushi restaurant in town. The all you can eat and drink is a great value.

This is always a great go to place for me and my family, especially it being so close to where they live.  AYCE (and drink sake or budlight sun-wed) with competetive pricing  great selection of rolls food sides and more, the service used to be amazing here, a go to place I would always bring friends and family to...however the last few times I've gone.. it's been over crowded with slow service, or we were given attitude from start to end of the dining experience from our waitress. Used to be regulars, at least dine every month.. but how I'm treated when giving a place business means a lot, time for another place.
Pretty good for all you can eat. DO NOT order the Lasagna Roll! Fuuuuuuuuuh!!!

I heard this was a great place so I Tried it. The all you can eat menu was great but I give this place gets 2 stars because customer service sucked. Most all you can eat places ensure to keep coming back knowing you want to keep ordering as you go. But I waited forever to get refills and order! I was more annoyed than anything. Our server kept going to the hostess stand to talk to the employees... While I'm waiting! Too bad this place has great food but not worth the customer service.
Really good nigiri. Cold, fresh, and topped with just the right amount of sauce. Crunch roll is delicious.

This place used to be good but the service is horrible!  Sushi is good but nothing too great.    Look around the workers look like they "love" (facetious) their job! It seemed like it was all the workers that night...  Just few things that happened with customer service during our last visit that I don't think we'll go back.   It's too bad cause they are close to our home but if we're going to drop close to a Bill at this place they need to be a little more excited & on top of their game with their service to their guests.    Sushi gave the extra star or I would have kept this at a 1 star.   Oh on side note: our son is 3.5yrs but he's big for his age. Looks like he can be 5. They use height to determine if they charge kids.  Needless to say he was slightly above height so they charged us. He barely eats... maybe few pieces of a roll & eats edamames. I tried to plea with them about that issue but they didn't bug.  Too bad. So many sushi places in town. Little more of a drive but worth us driving to feel comfortable & happy customers.   Show your guests you care & we'd consider coming back.

I would actually give it 3.5 stars but I rounded up for a couple of reasons.  The service was very friendly and efficient, and I really like the half-roll options.  I think another reviewer said that this place was kind of the Panda Express of sushi.  I would agree with that.  It is good, but not originally great.

So this may sound a little exaggerated however it is not. We went out to eat at Sushi Tachi tonight and my husband went against his better judgement. We (daughter and I) love this restaurant and hubby just doesn't care for Sushi like we do so he planned to have something different. We were all happy.  When we arrive, the restaurant is full and there are several people waiting for tables. We decided we would sit at the bar because we have never sat at the bar before. Everything is going well and my daughter and I ordered our second roll and my hubby is eating his teriyaki chicken bowl. The Chef hands me my 2nd roll and my husband taps me on the arm and shows me a screw he had in his mouth after a bite of his food. It looked like a screw from the wok handle. So we call the waitress over and she takes the food away and gets her manager. Now my stomach is upset and I delayed starting on my roll. My daughter asked the chef for something else and he looked up at us and snot dripped from his nose down to the Sushi prep board where he was making rolls. I about died right there. My daughter and I looked at each other in shock and I said "aw hell nah" and stood up walked to the front and told the cashier we are not eating the sushi or paying for the food my husband didn't get to eat. Then I told him about the snotty chef. He apologized profusely and still charged me $35. I will never eat there again and it will be a loooooong time before I have sushi or food that others prepare for that matter.

Great local spot for all you can eat sushi. We've been going here for over 10 years & the place hasn't changed one bit which is great. The service & employees have always been excellent. They also offer sake & bud light w/the all you can eat. I also enjoy the miso soup esp during a cold winter night.
Great food and service. Wife and I shared the sushi dinner for two -$25 Cooper helped us eat ours and (and he ate his) we could hardly finish ours.  Price is awesome.

Sunday-Wednesday for $26.95 you get AYCE along w/ AYCD Hot Sake & Bud Light.  Do I REALLY need to say more???  Ok - you twisted my arm.  The meal was fabulous - the appetizers (I love green oysters), the rolls, the sake - everything was worth every penny.  My new "go to" rolls - Ay chi chi (this roll has habanero sauce on it!) and any of the rolls w/ sliced lemon on them.  They do an incredibly thin slice of lemon - the slight hint of citrus really add something special that I haven't experienced at other sushi restaurants.  This is a bit out of the way for us, but again, we enjoyed the food so much we will definitely be back again...I'm not sure you can beat the value anywhere else in Vegas.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the service could have been a little more attentive.  All of the servers seem to share all of the tables - which I guess in theory is great, but in practice I think they lose track of what tables they've attended to and which ones they haven't.  We did have to flag them down a few times to fill waters, sakes, and order more rolls.

I don't know if my expectations where just too high, but I wasn't really blown away by this place, but I liked it.  It was a decent meal (had the salmon special) and the food was all good and we definitely were satisfied with our meal. The one thing that I didn't love was that I found the service kind of sloppy... although we did arrive just after a dinner rush on a Friday night, so I'll give them that.  Just to note, I'm not a local N. Las Vegas-er, I'm originally for Toronto and now live in NYC, so I'm also a bit spoiled when it comes to Japanese.  We were on vacation, staying in the area, so we decided to check it out based on Yelp reviews.  I would 100% go back and recommend it others looking for decent Japanese in N. Las Vegas.

Tachi is a delightful all-you-can-eat sushi bar & restaurant.  The Kassandra roll is a particular highlight if you enjoy yellowtail, and if you like a nice seafood medley I recommend the Sunrise roll. The all-you-can-drink hot sake or Bud Light (Sunday - Wednesday) is a perfect counterpoint to the fish.   Service is generally quick, though if the house is full you may experience a brief wait for your first set of rolls. Our server Jamie was attentive, polite, and pleasant. We strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone in town who wants lots of good sushi without the hassle of dealing with the Strip.
The best sushi in town, plus they have all you can eat. So you get all you can eat of the best sushi in town for a great price. I will not go to another sushi place. Just saying.

Sushi Tachi...what happened??  You used to be one of my favorite AYCE spots in town...and definitely the best place in the North to get my fix!  Most of the nigiri was good, but there were some cuts that were boring and slightly stale, and others that were completely falling apart! Some of the cuts were so thin that they were literally ripping apart off the rice without me touching it! Maybe it is a newer chef, or maybe they need to sharpen their knives....Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-tachi-north-las-vegas?select=oMnMM29bSkwcsK7hv_PCPQ#oMnMM29bSkwcsK7hv_PCPQ  I didn't even take a pic of the Unagi because I was embarrassed for them...presentation wise, and the flavor and consistency was not there. I would say it was the worst Unagi I've had, and I am fairly easy to please.  Not all of it was bad though.  The salmon rolls and sake nigiri tasted good, as well as a few other cuts of fish.  But nothing really stood out or made a statement.  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-tachi-north-las-vegas?select=nKhIP82ww3Gp16U6uBgYXg#nKhIP82ww3Gp16U6uBgYXg  Service was also slow on parts...we ordered the Amaebi with fried shrimp heads, but we never received the heads. Since we were getting full, we never brought it up to them. We all ordered dessert, ate dessert, got the bill...and paid. Then the shrimp heads came out LOL.  Amaebi : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-tachi-north-las-vegas?select=esR6TXBJwPtJXmlispBj7Q#esR6TXBJwPtJXmlispBj7Q  Finished off with some tempura ice cream : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-tachi-north-las-vegas?select=c7IPzJpOtnUa2JqQ-LlnWw#c7IPzJpOtnUa2JqQ-LlnWw  I won't try to steer you away from Tachi, but I can't recommend it to anyone anymore! Drive farther in town to get something better!

I've been a regular here for years now and with good reason. The fish is always fresh and of high quality, as are all of the other ingredients. Even the sushi rice is on point in terms of taste and texture. My favorite rolls are the vegetarian roll, the New York Girl in Vegas sans cream cheese and light mayo and the Gone With the Wind has crispy salmon skin (which I love). Hand rolls and nigiri are also fantastic- I love the tuna, salmon, red snapper and uni... Although you really can't go wrong with anything you choose. Sunday through Wednesday is also all you can drink Bud Light and House sake with regular AYCE sushi. It's been 5+ years since my first trip here. I've tried other places around the valley, but this is it for me on the Northside!   PRO TIP: The 911 roll is actually extremely hot; they are not over-exaggerating!   PRO TIP 2: ALWAYS TRY THE EVER-CHANGING MONTHLY SPECIAL!   PRO TIP 3: Don't forget to grab a stamp card if you're a first timer- I promise, you will be back. And if you forget yours, they will start you a new one and combine it with the other.   Enjoy!
Bunk sushi spot. Mushy rice and taste like it's been sitting long. All served on a chipped plate. This place needs to lose a few stars.

This is my #1 go to sushi restaurant so far in Vegas. AYCE is the golden path. Recommended rolls Spider, Lisa Lisa, Monster, and various others 2 many 2 list! Might have a wait time, restaurant isn't that big, but worth the wait.

Probably my favorite sushi place in vegas. The service is always great, and our server is always so nice . Christy ann , and joy are always so helpful and patient when we order. They always recommend new and different things from our regular , "dinner special". I recommend the dragon roll, tiger roll, shrimp tempura roll and most definiteley the tempura ice cream...(deep-fried ice-cream). Overall its a great place to come dine with friends or family! I absoluteley love it!

This place is going down hill! My wife and I used to frequent it as one of the better all you can eat sushi places in vegas.  The waitress took my wife's order wrong and then got mad and tried to force her to eat it anyway! She has been ignoring us for the past 20 min as we have been trying to order more, so much for all you can eat!  Do your self a favor and try yama sushi or sushi kaya!  They have better sushi and way better service even on their busiest night! For 70$ a couple, spend the extra gas and drive to yama sushi or sushi kaya!  Best two places to eat in vegas!
Checked this place out because I was in the area. Way too much rice on my rolls and nigiri. Everything tasted bland.  I'll stick to Sushi Neko or Yama Sushi in China Town for my go to spots.

This is the bast sushi restaurant in town. I came here very regularly. Staff and chef are all.friendly. their sushi rice is small but fish is big. Which I.love it so.much. I don't want to be filled by the rice.  Food are very fresh. Chef told us their fish are freah cut everyday. I never has problem foe eating there. Price is very good. Espeiclaly whenbyou came in Sunday to Wed. They also have all you can.drink. beer sake. All free @@

I don't think I'd return to this venue.  Although it's one of a few sushi restaurants in the area, I'd rather travel a little further for decent sushi.  Everything, from the nigiri to the hand rolls to the long rolls, were served with way too much rice.  And they specifically state on the menu that you'll be charged for any food leftover on your plate.  The Cajun albacore was so not edible that I hid the other nigiri piece in a napkin for fear of being charged for it.  The spicy scallop yum yum hand roll was not yummy at all and only had a few pieces of scallop tucked inside.  When I saw it, I thought they had mistakenly given me a California hand roll.  My dad really liked his tempura udon so we may go back for the non-sushi food items.

Fantastic food, only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the service. Slow when busy, slow when I was one of 5 other diners. Maybe disorganized is a better word. The food is really excellent though, very fresh and reasonably priced. Worth the wait if you plan accordingly. If you like plum wine, theirs is excellent.
All you can eat is mediocre to poor at best, but the service is good and the all you can drink bud light is awesome.
friendly neighborhood sushi place. great lil spot. well priced. try the baked 702 and the white tuna. sun-Wed. includes bud light and sake! my new sushi place

Not sure why they have 5 stars. Not sure why they have 2 business listings with 2 different addresses when there's only 1 Tachi.   I've been coming to Tachi for years since this place is close to home. The quality has declined over the years. We would normally do AYCE but they also have a regular menu to order from.  Miso Soup: This is not the version that's made with love.  The soup is pre-made and the tofu pieces are so tiny. 1/5  Sushi/Sashimi: Sashimi isn't included in AYCE. AYCE is about $24-26/person. Or you can get sushi/sashimi combo starting at $10. The quality of fish is inconsistent. Sometimes the fish looks like it was cut using a butter knife. Sometimes the fish is ice-cold. 2.5/5  Shumai: You can get these balls fried or steamed. Shumai is meant to be dipped in soy/ponzu sauce but they don't give you sauce here. 3/5  Donburi: Katsudon, raw egg on top of rice with hot broth. The hot broth cooks the raw egg so mix it all up as soon as the bowl touches your table. This is a good dish, however, when my sister ordered this the last time, it lacked flavor. They were not busy at all the last time we went so there's no excuse. Another inconsistency? 3/5  Since the location is convenient and sometimes we just don't want to drive 10 miles to get good AYCE, I guess we will continue to come here and keep hoping we catch them on a good day.

I first started coming here 5 years ago and have watched them gain in popularity. They have a wonderful selection of rolls, nigiri, and appetizers included on the all you can eat menu.   The only drawback for me, is I now have to go during the off hours. Dinner and lunch times they are very busy but worth the wait if you must!  They are quick and efficient anytime.
Food was great, moon roll, American dream roll and the oh! Philly roll were very good. The calamari was good. Service was fast we'd go again

Best sushi place in North  Vegas.  Even my 4 year old loves it too. She had me take her 2 days in a roll for her kids chicken teriyaki with California rolls, she finishes almost everything.  For me my favorite is the Sexygirl rolls. Great place and friendly staff.

Shame on you Sushi Tachi for charging my 68 lb 10 year old the same price you charged me for AYCE sushi. Nevermind the fact that $24.95 for lunch is by far the highest priced AYCE in the valley, how can you legitimately charge children prices based on their height? My 10 year old is tall for her age but she's very thin and eats like a bird. My 8 year old out-weighs her by 7 lbs. Unfortunately the pricing wasn't the only issue with our lunch here this past Sunday. For starters the service was sloooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooww. By slow I mean we ordered 4 rolls as soon as we sat down and didn't get one of the rolls til literally 45 minutes later. We ordered 2 volcano rolls (the kids love them), the waiter held up 2 fingers and verified we wanted 2 volcano rolls, yet we received a Volcano Roll #2 which is practically nothing like the regular volcano roll and has cooked salmon on the inside and outside. Some rolls we had to order twice because they simply never came. This is unacceptable service for a $25 pp meal. They seriously need to hire more people, 2 servers and 2 sushi chefs is clearly not enough for the small crowd on a Sunday afternoon. I overheard one server apologizing to the table beside us when we walked in so I'm sure we weren't the only disgruntled patrons. Good bye Sushi Tachi!

I ate at SUSHI TACHI on Sunday with my friends, a party of six.  At first they were going to charge my 2 year old child a kid's meal...I mean common now, what 2 year old eats a lot.  All of us ordered all you can eat, a total of 6.  We asked for a seperate check my husband and I.  After our meal, they charged us 18% gratuity because we came in all together.  I complained about it because we did ask for seperate checks in the beginning.  Then the waitress said " but I didn't charge you for your daugther"...Oh that got me upset because her including the gratuity on my tab shouldn't have to justify my daughter not being charged.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not a cheap person, I would've tipped but for her to include my daughter in the situation was wrong.  I felt like they weren't trying to resolve the situation but only make it worst.  I replied back by saying "go ahead charge my daughter then"....They changed the bill & charged me for my daughter $7.95.  I looked at the kid's menu and it was the most expensive item on there.  My daughter ate 2 sushi's & green tee ice cream.  I've eaten at other sushi restaurants and NOT ONE OF THEM charged me for my 2 year old daughter.  Very disappointed!!!!  Sushi was okay but SUSHI MON's is the best.

What's not to love, it's our neighborhood joint. The sushi is good, the service is always consistent and good, sometimes they mix up the orders but then you get to try something new :).  Good solid place to eat sushi, drink beer and watch sports.

Food 4/5 Price 4/5 Service 1/5  Gave it another try almost a year later....drinks weren't refilled we had to keep asking.  To go box was forgotten we had to ask twice...never once asked if we were doing ok....just plain bad service!  Food was good and good portion for price but if you like courteous service and friendly staff you are out of luck at this place.  Couple who walked in while I was waiting to pay walked out because no one helped them.  Nuff said....

When I lived in Aliante for five years, this was my go to spot for AYCE. Every year I always came close to letting my frequent card for a free meal expire. So doing the gorilla math, I was averaging just under a visit per month at Sushi Tachi. This place always had me coming back for more. The occasion for my most recent visit was to have dinner with my family that lives on the north side of town.  We actually waited 30 minutes at 7:30 to be seated on a Wednesday night, so the place does get pretty busy. Ten minutes of the wait we were just waiting for the table to be bused. I would always recommend sitting at the sushi bar because the chefs are friendly and give you good service but since we had a party of five we wanted a table. We had an enjoyable visit once we were sat.  I had the AYCE of course and had no complaints except for the uni. It was on the brownish side. The value comes with the Bud Light and sake. I also always down a sake shooter and have an order of amaebi with every visit. One bonus is they have halibut which is not guaranteed to be found on every sushi menu.  A couple dinner boxes of chicken teriyaki were also ordered at the table and for around $11, you get your money's worth: miso soup, salad, chicken, full California roll, and large size order of tempura.
