Although I don't come often enough to fill a frequent card anymore, Sushi Tachi still remains a reliable place to have AYCE.

My brother brought me here for an early mother's day lunch yesterday. We were seated right away. At the time we arrived there wasn't much customer's. Service was okay, although I think our server could have spoken a little nicer and have more knowledge of the items on the menu.  I am from Maui visiting family here and I was not impressed with the food presentation or the taste of most of the items I ordered. I was so excited to try this restaurant and so bummed it wasn't a great experience for me.

THIS PLACE SUCKS. If a Negative star was offered I'd use it. First the service is very slow and these guys forgot protions of our order which we never received so our service gets a - 2 stars. Bathrooms are very dirty, floors are wet with many discarded paper towels on the floor. This gets the same -2 stars. All you can eat is not a great value. After waiting 15 minuted between food requests seemed excessive but consider if you exceed the 1 hour limit on the all you can eat means you dont get your fill. So overall,-2 stars and i will not come back.

I used to love coming here the sushi is good ,but the service is not very great. The servers are sometimes rude and don't check back for at least 15 minutes. I went without getting a refill for 15 minutes.This place was one of my favorites but since the last time I went it seems like the service went downhill.

Some days I just don't feel like driving far, but at the same time I don't want to cook.  Sushi Tachi is one of those limited restaurants in Aliante that I will go to.  I had been here once for their lunch special, so I decided to give it a try for dinner.  The value for food is good, for $10.95 you get teriyaki chicken, shrimp/vegetable tempura, california roll, miso soup, rice, cucumber salad, green salad.  This isn't the best food, but probably the best in this area.  I left extremely full and satisfied.  This place was relatively packed on a Friday night, so I'm guessing it's the go to spot for a lot of AYCE fans up north.  I would definitely return here for cheap meal, especially with the limited options in Aliante.
Great sushi, cool clean restaurant.NFL jerseys. Good food. All you can eat and drink sunday- Wednesday.

We used to come here a bit when they first joined the neighborood. As th le family grew, we kinda stopped coming. I will say, however, I would still get something to-go a few times during each pregnancy for these specific items: mixed green salad, oh! Philly roll, and their vegetable tempura. DONE. Made the belly happy.  I always loved their Oh! Philly roll. It is basically a cut roll of seaweed and rice, with salmon and cream cheese in the middle, then tempura fried.   The dressing they use for the mixed green salad is something I wish I had a big tub of because I would gladly drench, scoop, dip, my salad into it without regret. I also love their vegetable tempura because the veggies aren't over nor undercooked. It is cooked perfectly to compliment the crunch to the tempura batter.  With all that said, that's all I can say about Sushi Tachi in recent times. Today, we decided, more like I decided...let's go to Sushi Tachi for their AYCE. The last couple.times we had gone for actual sushi, we always left disappointed in the overall quality of their sushi. But, I'm pretty fair. It has been awhile, we've never gone for their AYCE, let's indulge...annnnd it's nearby so why not.  Service, the waitress was great! There werent too many people in there. Perhaps because tis a Tuesday around 1pm. Perfect! Lots of seating, not noisy, the babies can continue their sleep in peace.   I noticed they had revamped the look of their menu, cool. Also, their AYCE is now 60 mins lunch or dinner.  I was excited to dig in, but when I started looking thru the menu, I instantly felt bored. I don't know why. Maybe twas the sushi gods giving me the forewarning.  Anyhow, I got the Hawaiian roll (spicy tuna inside, tuna on top with spicy mayo drizzled on top of that topper), oh! Philly, spicy tuna cut roll, salmon skin roll, garlic tuna, and a seared tuna.   The only two that didn't disappointment, just happened to be the two that have been fried in some way (oh!philly and salmon skin incase I lost you there). Safe to say. Most things fried are usually oh so badly good, cant really fail on that end. All the ones which truly mattered, just disappointing. Sadly, Sushi Tachi just drizzle happy their sushis. Even a simple tuna nigiri is masked by some soy sauce base concoction. There was nothing garlic about.my garlic tuna, and certainly nothing seared about my seared tuna.   The only freshness about the tunas in my opinion, is that all my tuna dishes tasted like they came straight out of the fridge....Nothing like tasting the coldness to your fish. Literally, from fridge to cutting board. Don't like that. It's how I felt about my macaron experience. The Hawaiian roll was.unmemorable.   24.95 for an AYCE there literally made me say, man...I wish we went to Kaizen. Whaaaaa?!?! (In minion voice). I literally felt like I needed to change my Kaizen star rating after today's experience. I don't think they're worth 24.95 in my opinion. Sure you get some alcohol, but, I come for sushi. I got the alcohol, I got the sushi, but I also got disappointed with the overall quality and cleanliness may I add.  I have to give them 3 stars from the 3 items I love from here, and the service from our waitress. So, we will only return for my pregnancy craves minus the pregnant part. Officially done coming here for sushi.we were done along time ago...but this was the grand finale.   Definitely kid and stroller friendly (just don't bring in those side-by-side kind of strollers). Don't know if the buckles to their high chairs work as we didn't need it today.

I really like this place. I am very picky with my sushi but this place really does a good job and hits the spot. It is also conveniently minutes from my job, so lunch is always quick and easy.   I usually do go there on my lunch break and even as  a take out, it is very quick! Their lunch specials are very well priced for someone who usually is on a budget. I have yet to go for dinner yet..but i look forward to actually sit inside and enjoy more of it!
Kept forgetting my order and they keep you waiting so long just so they can charge you more. Worst sushi reaturant ive been to. Go to sushi kaya for better service and better sushi.
Hands down one of my favorite sushi places! The staff is always so nice and on top of things. The Vegas roll is a must!

Sushi Tachi has become my husband's and my place to go for sushi in NLV. The food is consistently good and service is exceptional. They have great Monday and Tuesday deals and a decent selection of rolls. All-you-can-eat is the way to go!   The only thing I don't like is once we were given lots of grief for bringing in a few chicken nuggets for my four-year-old (who doesn't like sushi or anything else the place offers). They almost didn't let us stay to eat! The next week - they had a sign up saying "no outside food". While I understand the rule, it's disappointing that I cant visit unless I don't have my kids with me.   Note to self: teach my kids to like sushi. Until then, I will not have many chances to visit Sushi Tachi! Beware parents - don't bring (outside) food for your kids in. They will turn you away. But if it's date night - I recommend this place! Thumbs up!

I've been here plenty of times, food is good BUT... something is Different. As I get my order I dive right in and eat a piece. What happen next was appalling. They OVER STUFF THE SASHIMI WITH RICE COMPACTING IT AND IT WAS EXTREMELY HEAVY. This was done on purpose so you don't eat as much because you will fill up twice as fast. Trying to  get over on customers. Adding the extra COMPACT HEAVY RICE made the food UN- ENJOYABLE. All I could taste was RICE, DRY ASS RICE. So now I'm stuck here trying to finish my first order 45mins later. This is some REAL ISH (SugarHoneyIceTea) I will not come back.

I used to work in the area and tried sushi for the first time here.. I liked it then.. this last time I went I wasn't too happy. I felt like the rolls had too much rice. Not sure what changed but this used to be my go to spot for sushi and I have to say it isn't anymore. Service was slow and we waited a while to get our order in and for the rolls to come out. It's a shame, this area needs a good sushi spot. Guess I'll have to continue making my journey to China town.

Most AMAZING Quality and Selection of Unique rolls that I have had at any AYCE Sushi house. MUST TRY THE Mahi Mahi roll , Moon River roll , Last Samurai roll and Sexy Girl rolls. All of their selections have Incredible flavors. Very fresh !! I will be back MANY TIMES !!!

The restaurant is very clean and the staff were very nice, considering we were in a large group for my besties birthday. The all you can eat sushi is the best value. I went with my favorite the California Roll. I also had some of the tiger, wet dream, and spider rolls. It was muy bueno. Overall I loved the experience, the only complaint is that my husbands teryaki chicken was bland, but it's a sushi place.

I love this place. The servers are nice and always smiling and the Sushi is amazing!! Great atmosphere and great food. Their All You Can Eat Sushi is worth it specially since it includes Sake and beer! Food is always fresh and delicious. One of my favorite Sushi places in Vegas.
The prices were on par the food was ok and the service was poor.  The staff at the register acted like it was an inconvenience I was coming in to order food.  Overall not impressed.

I used to like here. but last time visit was nightmare....  Came here for dinner around 5. 60min AYCE.i had to wait 30min to get the sushi!!  Only couple table was seated.they weren't busy.whats happen?? There wasn't soy sauce plate,no chopstick. We were three.come on woman!!we were three.Why you brought just one ?!then I have to ask again.  And server forgot some order from ours... I was about piss off like don't wanna pay any. But of course I did n left tip..But it was really sucks!!

our favorite barista introduced us to this place the other night and we are overjoyed that there's a good sushi joint located right in our neighborhood! we decided to take advantage of the 'all you can eat & drink' for $26.00 which is probably one of the best deals in town!! the sushi was extremely fresh and the ala carte items (cucumber salad, tempura, fried calamari, baked mussels, etc) were delicious. i couldn't get away from the potato wrapped shrimp!! YUMMMMM YUMMMMM. i highly recommend if you're in north las vegas - near aliante... stop by! you won't be disappointed!!

Wow, I don't understand why this place has so many 4 and 5 star reviews.  Unfortunately we were there on a Saturday, no all you can drink beer/sake (bud light/house sake).  We actually went around lunch and dinner time (got there at 3:45 dinner starts at 4).  They gave us the option to do AYCE lunch $23.95 or dinner $26.95.  I wanted to do dinner so I could order Uni but we opted for lunch and I'm so glad we did.  Since it was our first time there I wanted to scope it out and see how fresh their fish were.  Not so fresh!  I thought the nigiri was below average... the rice was undercooked and the fish smelled fishy and was cut horribly.  For example, the salmon nigiri we ordered was huge but not in a good way.  The texture of it was like biting into flesh or something, yuck.  It was definitely not melt in your mouth sushi.    The rolls were alright (then again the fish is smothered with sauce but we could still taste a little fishiness).  They made a roll for us they didn't have on the menu which was nice of them.  Poke was alright, although they gave only a few chunks of Ahi and lots of onion (I'm assuming it is Ahi).  The only rolls I enjoyed were the avocado roll and natto roll.  My husband wants to go back for their all you can drink night, I'm not sure if I will be joining him.  If I do I will be ordering ala carte (avocado and natto roll).

Awful.  Went last night for $26.95 dinner AYCE sushi. Sunday-Wednesday the AYCE sushi includes bud light and sake. I can only imagine that is what's keeping this place afloat.   I read in a lot of the reviews that the service was kinda slow so we ordered everything at once. 1.5 hours later we were still waiting for some of the rolls.   Waitress with short hair (she didn't have a nametag) was nice, but odd. Soy sauce on the table was empty the whole time we were there despite two requests.   Ordered the "baked scallop shell" twice because they forgot it the first time. What they brought me was almost comical...it was like they mixed up fake crab meat with the world's tiniest scallops and put it in a rammekin with mayo on top. When I bit into this hot mess the scallops were still frozen but the fake crab meat was hot. I almost tossed my cookies right there on the table.  It almost makes me wonder if the reason they didn't bring it out the first time i asked is because they were out of it so they tried to make something up. Here, feed this to the white girl....she won't know the difference!  Uni was completely melted and turning brown which tells me it is old.   Gross. Go somewhere else.

The food here was really good and the service was really quick too! Since moving, was having trouble finding a new sushi place closer to home. Little did I know it was literally right around the corner! Very good food and great friendly service.
Love Sushi Tachi! Always fast & friendly service. They offer great bento boxes for lunch. Try the Chi Chi roll :)
One of my go to sushi spots! Sushi tachi is around the corner from my house and I am so happy I found a place nearby with yummy sushi! Whenever I go I always get the AYCE and it always hits the spot.

I love Sushi Tachi. My brother and I love to eat lunch here on Sunday afternoons after a night of work. AYCE and drink is great. Order as fast as you can and it keeps on coming no complaining about whether you need to finish what is in front of you first or you can only order one or two things at a time. The nigiri is always great and the choices of specialty rolls is great. Upgrade to the dinner price and you are eating sweet shrimp and other specialties for a couple dollars more. Wonderful chefs and wait staff. Getting hungry already.

I went out there for lunch and it was inexpensive and good. I love the decor and the ambience. I didn't try the all you can eat sushi, but it was very appealing. The sushi was fresh. The service was inviting and warm, but lack a little personal touch. I wish they could smile more. It was busy for where its located and the wine store next door is a great compliment.

My brother told me to pick a new place tp eat to take me to celebrate my birthday (a little late might I add). I yelped and came upon this place.   Let me tell you, this is the best sushi place I've been too. It's a little pricey but it's definitely worth every single penny. The waiter ( forgot his name, sorry ) was wonderful, always with a smile and always making sure we were doing ok, very polite and always asking if we needed anything else plus he laughed at my brothers jokes (that's definitely a plus). I had the plum wine and loved it.  To make this story shorter because I could keep on going. I highly recommend Sushi Takashi, we'll be coming back for sure .

Some of the best sushi I've ever eaten. No joke. Fresh, delicious, perfect texture,. All the things you want from sushi. Will definitely be a place I frequent often. No need to look for more sushi in Vegas, at least for me.

My family and I enjoyed the food and service. It Was not too busy at the time we went(9:30 pm). We lived the spider roll and chubby roll the most. All you can eat sushi was perfect. Good came out quick, not a long wait at all. Friendly staff and clean restaurant. The atmosphere was nice as well.

The AYCE is a reasonable price, and if you like to eat lots of fresh yummy sushi...it's the best deal.  I've  always had a great experience here.  Fresh food, good service, and free sake Sun-Wed. The chefs know what I like, and just feed me. Sometimes the service is a bit slow when it's peak dinner time, but I get it. The Hotmama roll, and NY girl in Vegas are my favorites. I like that they don't cover my rolls with sauce.
Visit here often... Monthly specials are always on point never disappointed...  Rolls sometimes fall apart not always rolled tight...

This is a really great sushi spot. Fresh, delicious food, clean and relaxing environment with really fast service. We had to wait once for a take out order because they were really busy but that was understandable. Everyone is polite and helpful. At some point they made it so you can order "half rolls", meaning 4-5 pieces of a roll instead of a full roll; this is amazing for All You Can Eat. I like to try all different rolls but sometimes I don't want to eat 8 pieces of each (and get full before I can try everything). Love it!

Friendly staff. Service was good (sushi bar and from the wait staff). Brightly lit and spacious dining area.  Good food, great AYCE value if you take advantage of the unlimited Bud Lite and House sake promo.  And the ability to order just about all the rolls in 1/2 portion size.  I ended up at Tachi because I was turned away by the overwhelming response to Sushi Mon's 10year anniversary promotion (Maryland Pkwy location) and was in the vacinity running some errands.  When I arrived at 5:15pm, the place was still fairly empty, but was close to 75% capacity when I left at 6:30pm.  The restaurant definitely has a good following in the NW.  The food was good, I enjoyed most of the items I ordered (san the Spider Roll I ordered at the end, which I thought was bland and the sushi rice didn't taste right - maybe it was a new batch or the end of one).  Anyway, here is my review of the items I also ordered: * Fried Calamari appetizer from the kitchen was excellent.  Just dried perfectly, with a light batter coating.  * N.Y. Girl In Vegas Roll - Pretty good, I enjoyed it overall, but would have like less mayo on it. * Dragon Roll - good stuff,great if you like eel. * One More Time Roll - Pretty good, but would be super if the mango used was more tasty and ripe (but we know mangos are not in season in the fall/winter). * Uni/Ikura/Garlic Tuna and all the nigiri I ordered were all good.  Very satisfied!  I skipped the dessert due to time constraint, but the restaurant offers the usual ice cream (green tea, red bean and plum) and during dinner one order of mochi ice cream (mango, strawberry or vanilla).  Price:  $24.95 (45 minutes) 11:30AM - 4:00PM $26.95 (60 minutes) 4:00PM - 10:30PM  Misc comments: 1. The chair at the sushi bar is maybe 6 inches too low.  It felt awkward sitting there at first, but the padding on the chair was comfortable. 2. Waitresses were on top of refills, I didn't have to ask for hot tea once and the used plates were cleared quickly. 3. The young Japanese waitress is cute. 4. There are off menu items (specialty rolls) that you can order, but the names and images of it are hanging as pictures on the back wall.  You can totally miss it, if you are seated in the wrong part of the restaurant. 5. Anthony, the Mexican Sushi Chef, was great.  Made the rolls quickly and profeciently.  Location:  NW Las Vegas. Perfect for those living in the Aliante area.  Service:  4.5/5  No complaints here.  Food: 4/5  The fish are fresh.  Good selection overall.  No daily specials like at some other sushi bars (not a negative, just pointing out a fact).  Price:  3/5  In line with other AYCE sushi bars in Las Vegas.  Parking:  3/5  In the same strip mall with a gym, parking wasn't a problem for me, but it was pretty full when I left.  I would definitely go back if I am in the area.

This place not only serves fresh, delicious sushi...but it's all you can eat!! It's not buffet style, like you would expect either...you order off of a menu and they bring it fresh!! Their all-you-can eat menu also includes apps like miso soup & edamame and dessert, like green tea ice cream. You can also get a punch card and once you have so many all-you-can eat meals, you get one free! Definitely a great deal. The employees are also all very friendly! You will not be disappointed by eating here!!

We were in the area and starving for lunch. We decided against AYCE and instead ordered some lunch specials and a couple of appetizers to share.  We ordered the shumai and gyoza to start. These were decent, but nothing amazing. Two of my dining companions complained about the shumai tasting overly fishy. I ordered the sushi lunch for my entree. It included five pieces of sushi and a California roll. The sushi and roll were not good. The fish was not fresh and the California roll had an unpleasant texture.   The service was really friendly and they accommodated all the specific requests our table had, but I don't think I would come back even if I was in the area again.

I don't eat sushi but my boyfriend and I just moved to the area and we were looking for a new spot. Came here and got a beef teriyaki bowl. Delicious and filling. He is loving all the sushi. Service is good, but could be that there was only three other diners here. We'll be back! Only bad things: no jalepeno poppers, orgasm sauce, and the menu combinations on the rolls weren't that great. Flavor was there.
